characters: SHOOTING, DRENCHED IN GASOLINE AND ACTING PECULIAR..."
IN BOXER'S MURDER... SEEN OUTSIDE BUILDING SHORTLY BEFORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man in a puffy foam-rubber rhinoceros costume dancing under the bright friendly lights of a television studio. Another rhino and various foam-rubber animals dance behind him to the happy MUSIC. The rhino finishes his number and takes a bow. A bleacher full of kids bursts into wild applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the taping. The rhino lumbers down the hallway toward wardrobe. He is suddenly grabbed by two large men and dragged out through the exit into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... where several   thugs in overcoats emerge from the shadows and start   beating him with lead pipes. One of the men pulls out   a GUN and SHOOTS the rhino several times. The SHOTS    REVERBERATE through the empty garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the taping of another children's show -- "Rainbow Randolph and the Krinkle Kids." RANDOLPH SMILEY, a clean-cut man with a happy face and yellow bow tie, dances through Rainbowland with the "Krinkle Kids" (little people in top hats). He sings one of his signature songs: "Friends Come In All Sizes." One of the main Krinkle Kids -- ANGELO PIKE -- dances behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) 'Friends come in all sizes That's a fact! It's True! All colors of the rainbow from Mauve to Blue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their names may not be different and their shoes may not match One might say 'grasp' while the other says 'snatch' Some like to toss while others like to caaaaatch... Beeee- caaaause... Friends come in all sizes Take it from me! Golly Gee! Size never matters when you want some friendly patter From a pal who is true and can lift you when you're blue You can count on him and he can count on yoooouuuu! It's true... that... (big finish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends come in all sizes!'

dialogues.speaker: RAINBOW RANDOLPH MERCHANDISE
dialogues.text: "Sugar Rainbows Cereal," plastic toys lined up on store shelves, kids playing with Randolph dolls, kids eating "Rainbow Potato Chips" and "Rainbow Candies." A "Rainbow Burster," a kind of gun that shoots plastic rainbows. Marquees announcing upcoming live appearances, etc. We get the picture. Rainbow Randolph is the king of the kid shows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A suburban-looking HUSBAND and WIFE enter. They find Rainbow Randolph sitting alone, drinking a Scotch. Hair slicked back, sans bow tie, the friendly face no longer looks so friendly. He nods for them to sit down. After a nervous beat, the Husband puts a briefcase on the table and slides it to Randolph. Randolph takes a gulp of his Scotch. He unsnaps the briefcase and opens it. Five grand stares him in the face. HUSBAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... uh... you'll make sure my boy dances up front, right? Where he'll get the most camera time? Randolph slams the briefcase shut, startling the couple. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want your kid on the show?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HUSBAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of... of course. WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, very much. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then don't tell me how to run my fucking business. HUSBAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, we were just -- Randolph rises. He takes a final gulp of his Scotch and picks up the briefcase. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you if a spot opens up. He starts to walk off. Suddenly, the Husband and Wife jump up from the table holding guns. HUSBAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze, you cocksucker! WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the briefcase! Federal agents storm into the bar and surround Randolph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bundles of the morning editions are tossed onto the curb from passing trucks.   The various headlines blare:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rainbow Randolph/Krinkle Kid set is being dismantled. Backdrops are rolled up and the giant rainbow centerpiece is wheeled off. Workers with push brooms sweep up tons of glittery "magic Rainbow dust."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are TIGHT ON the sweating face of a MAN who looks like he's about to be executed.

dialogues.speaker: STOKES
dialogues.text: is standing at the end of a long conference table as the NETWORK BRASS glares at him. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (addressing the brass) Gentlemen, let me be the first to say, in all sobriety, that I'm as shocked and outraged as all of -- The network CEO, a hog of a man, cuts him off. CEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save it for the papers, Stokes. We've got nervous sponsors and an angry public -- a combination uglier than two monkeys fucking. What are you doing about it? STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir, I'm currently in the process of compiling a list of viable replacements and it's my hope... CEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean replacements?    With background checks? I assure you, Mr. Stokes, this network cannot survive another Rainbow Randolph. The goddamn P.R. department looks like the Jim Jones camp. Another EXECUTIVE chimes in. EXECUTIVE #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, Stokes, this was your dog that crapped on our rug. EXECUTIVE #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We trusted you, Frank. And now we're in a tight spot. We have to post our quarterly earnings next month, for Christ's sake. CEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever takes that slot has to be a straight arrow. Clean as a whistle. EXECUTIVE #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Someone who'll take the heat off. One of those sweater types. Any chance of luring Fred Rogers away from P.B.S.?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: EXECUTIVE #4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, if we back up the Brinks truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. The idea now is to stop the hemorrhaging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better fix this, Stokes. Get us a white bread replacement, fast. Bland, milk toast. Not a speck of controversy. A giant hand slams on the table. All heads snap. The CEO drags his fingers along the shiny mahogany. Deafening sound. CEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calm and measured) Squeaky fucking clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stokes sits behind his mahogany desk, sipping a glass of wine as he goes over potential Randolph replacements with NORA BISHOP, his pretty protege. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bumble Bee Billy? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading from a list) Wife beater. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Square Dance Danny? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still appealing the mail fraud thing. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skippy Black and the Tippy Trolls? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black was deported, and the trolls... well, who gives a shit. Nora kicks the table in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is impossible. If I ever see that Rainbow Randolph again I'll strangle him. Choke the life out of him. Squeeze his scrawny neck until his eyes pop out of his skull and bounce off the walls... STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before indulging such cheery fantasies, let's just concentrate on saving my job. Shall we? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Frank. Stokes flips through a thick stack of files.      He sudd stops at one. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on with Sheldon Mopes these days. Nora laughs. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Have we sunk to that level already? Smoochy the Rhino? What a sap. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sap's just the pill we need right now. Mopes is a straight arrow. Always has been. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy can't get arrested, Frank. He can't even break into the birthday party circuit. Last I heard he was working hospitals and nursing homes. He's a joke. Stokes stands up and walks around the room. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth of the matter is, a successful children's show has always depended on two simple elements: a fuzzy costume and a lot of hype. Strip away the foam rubber and the network money and they're all jokes. Marginal talents.. cabaret acts... off- Broadway runoff...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I probably have ten acts in my development file -- acts I've been cultivating -- that are more deserving than Sheldon Mopes. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And each one a moral question mark. Something I can't risk at the moment. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated) We can do better than this guy, Frank. He brings nothing to the table. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except ethics. With Mopes, there's never been a whiff of controversy. The man's an ethical, harmless, cornball. In short, a glass of milk on two legs. Stokes stops pacing. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask me to do it. You know I'll do anything for you, but please... not this... Stokes gazes out the window at the city. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go find Smoochy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lighted Ferris wheel spins CENTER FRAME. We CRANE DOWN and eventually LAND ON a side street with the amusement park looming in the b.g. We're in FRONT of a small building. The half-lit neon sign reads: CONEY ISLAND METHADONE CENTER. We DRIFT THROUGH the double doors THROUGH the reception area where random junkies loiter and fill out paperwork. We CONTINUE DOWN a narrow hallway as the faint sound of someone SINGING and playing the GUITAR INCREASES. We finally burst THROUGH another set of doors marked "Treatment Room." The singing now fills our ears as we PUSH IN ON the "performer" -- a big, puffy, orange rhinoceros. Smoochy. Or to be more specific, SHELDON MOPES.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Smoochy sits on a stool with his guitar and sings to the patients as they stand in line before a sliding glass window, where a nurse hands each person a little cup of methadone which they immediately drink. The Smoochy costume is a mass of misshapen orange foam rubber that exposes Sheldon's painted face in the front. A multi-colored horn protrudes from his forehead. SMOOCHY (SHELDON)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing to the tune of 'She'll be Comin' round the Mountain') 'We'll get that monkey off your back, Yes we will, yes we will We'll get that monkey off your back, Yes we will...' 'We'll get that monkey off your back And get your life right back on track If you'll just give up the smack Yes you will, yes you will!!' The song ends.       A few baffled junkies applaud. SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, fellas. I'm rooting for you! We PAN AWAY FROM Sheldon TO the exit.      Standing there her coat, looking mortified, is Nora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora sits in the reception area. Sheldon emerges in his street clothes. He carries Smoochy's body on a hanger over his shoulder and carries a large shopping bag which holds Smoochy's head. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mopes? Sheldon stops. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh, saw your performance tonight. Very... (searching) ... spirited. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Thanks. I would've done a longer set if that guy hadn't pulled a knife on the security guard. Once the pepper spray starts flyin', that's it for the encores. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that did put a damper on the evening, didn't it? SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a new patient?   On the juice, as we say? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, no. But it's sweet of you to assume so. She hands him her card.     He reads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Nora Bishop. V.P. of Development. Kidnet.' (to Nora)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good gravy. You work for Kidnet? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As stated. Sheldon grabs her hand and shakes it. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's a pleasure to meet you, Nora. A real honor. Hey, you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: WHILE LATER
dialogues.text: Sheldon and Nora stand at the crowded counter at Nathan's. Sheldon ravenously eats his sloppily- garnished, oddly colored hot dog. Nora winces as she watches him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with full mouth) Soy dogs... never thought I'd live to see the day. Organic, rich in natural protein, and nobody gets killed. Although I do feel bad for the beans. Just kidding. Sure you don't want one? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe it or not, no. He takes another bite. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So anyway, like I was saying, people always tell me, 'You gotta network, Sheldon... you gotta sell yourself... or you'll be playing the drug clinics and shopping centers the rest of your life.' And you know what I tell 'em? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't the foggiest. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell 'em, it's not about the old handshake and back slap game. It's not about adding fuel to the shlock machine. It's about doing good work. Having integrity. Making people happy and delivering a positive message. Foundations are built with concrete, not plaster of Paris! He pulls the stained, misshapen Smoochy head from the shopping bag. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is concrete!   This is integrity! NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) I can see that. Sheldon realizes his voice was getting too loud. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. As you can imagine, living by your convictions can be a little stressful at times.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all have our cross to bear. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I was raised by my grandfather, and Grandpop paved driveways for a living... NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we going into a story? SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thing is, he didn't really pave them. Just covered them with black paint. Of course, once the first rain came along, people realized they'd been swindled. I vowed to myself back then that I'd never make a living through deception. Never. Whadda ya think of them apples? Nora looks glassy-eyed.      She takes a deep breath. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason I'm here today, Mr. Mopes, as fate would have it, Kidnet is currently looking for a performer with... convictions. And integrity. Someone like... She almost chokes on the word. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... yourself. Sheldon laughs. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. Got any more jokes? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I could top that one. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold the phone. You're telling me that Kidnet is finally ready to do a show of Smoochy quality? Of Smoochy caliber?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly) Yes... I believe we're ready to push ourselves to that level. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew this day   would come! After all these   years I finally meet someone in   the business who gets what I do.    Who gets what I'm all about. You    get me, don't you, Nora? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid so. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Miss V.P. of Development... let's go make history!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIDNET STUDIO WARDROBE ROOM. A team of designers and seamstresses cut, sew and shape endless sheets of orange foam rubber. Sheldon stands on a wooden box as he's measured from head to toe. On the wall is a blueprint labeled "Smoochy the Rhino -- REDESIGN." A costume designer walks over with the new Smoochy head and places it on Sheldon. As seamstresses fit him with the new Smoochy costume, various signs and billboards FLOAT THROUGH the FRAME, trumpeting copy like: "IT'S ALMOST SMOOCHY TIME!"

dialogues.speaker: KIDNET STUDIO -C.
dialogues.text: Sets, props, and camera equipment are rolled into the studio. Through a SERIES of DISSOLVES we see the Smoochyland Magic Jungle take shape.

dialogues.speaker: KIDNET STUDIO -C
dialogues.text: A choreographer maps out a number for Smoochy and the "Rhinettes." (The Rhinettes are the former Krinkle Kid little people with horns strapped to their foreheads.)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nora and Stokes watch from the wings with a mixture of uncertainty and disgust.

dialogues.speaker: WARDROBE ROOM
dialogues.text: A seamstress zips up the back of the finished, redesigned Smoochy costume. Sheldon stands proudly before the design team. Smoochy is now television ready: smoothed out, more colorful, less lumpy and exuding sunshiny happiness.

dialogues.speaker: STUDIO -C
dialogues.text: Smoochy is about to enter with the Rhinettes.      ANGELO former Krinkle Kid, stands beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angelo, you were always my favorite Krinkle Kid. The way you'd click your heels during the 'Jellybean Jam.' Real artistry. I'm honored to have you as a Rhinette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A job's a job.

dialogues.speaker: STUDIO -C
dialogues.text: Suddenly lights up in all its multi-colored Smoochyland glory. The bleachers are full of children. ANNOUNCER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, kids! Who's your favorite rhino? The kids in the bleachers all scream in unison. KIDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoochy! Smoochy bounds out on stage followed by the Rhinettes who form a dancing circle around him. SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, kids!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KIDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Smoochy! SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be a fantabulous day in Smoochyland!! The kids cheer as Smoochy and the Rhinettes featuring Ang Pike, go into their "It's a Fantabulous Day in Smoochylan number -- a catchy, bouncy song and dance routine that pl in the sugar-coated jungle of Smoochyland. SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) 'Ohhhh... it's a fantabulous day in Smoochy-land/Let's have a great big cheer for the Smoochy-land band/We'll dance with our jungle pals, won't that be grand/Oh, it's a fantabulous day in Smoochy- land!' Smoochy dances right UP TO the CAMERA, FILLING the FRAME with his friendly, puffy face. END of prep MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A disheveled Randolph paces on a deserted dock. The Brooklyn Bridge looms in the b.g. A car pulls up in the b.g. Stokes gets out. Randolph moves under an awning. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was starting to think that maybe you weren't coming. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agreed to meet you, didn't I?    I had a dinner engagement. Randolph takes a swig from a flask. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? You know, I used to have dinner engagements. Sometimes four, five a night. Dinner... drinks... I was the toast of the fucking town. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't start, Randolph.   Please.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice rising) Cars, boats, whores and horses, I had 'em all. When I walked into a restaurant, ten guys reached for my hat. When I stood up to take a piss, they cleared the rest room. I'd walk down the street and traffic stopped, mouths gaped. You know why? You know why, Frank? (now shouting) I was Rainbow fucking Randolph! That's why! STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you through? RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You're in a hurry? You don't have time for me? The guy who earned for you? The guy who put those fucking suits on your back and the pheasant au vin in your Brooklyn mouth? STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's fair to say we helped each other. Randolph suddenly breaks down. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading) You gotta fix it, Frank. You gotta get me my slot back. He now clings to Stokes' lapels. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I sit around while that rhinoceros... that horned carpetbagger gets a free ride on my dime? You and I have history, Frank! Please! Stokes pries Randolph's hands from his overcoat. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing I can do for you. Nothing. You're a pariah. I can't even be seen with you.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this to me, Frank. I'm in deep, deep shit. They kicked me out of the corporate penthouse... I got bookies breathing down my neck. I'm homeless! Don't you hear what I'm saying? I'm not gonna make it! The clock's ticking! Put yourself in my shoes, for Christ's sake! STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ugly truth is, your shoes have become my shoes. As long as the rhino's on the air, everything's by the book. No skim, no percentage. Nothing. The network wanted squeaky clean and they got it. And believe me, Mopes is sparkling. He looks Randolph squarely in the eye. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're totally broke? You don't have a dime left to your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Exactly! That's what I'm trying to tell you! Randolph looks at him hopefully as Stokes straightens his tie. STOKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't contact me again, Randy. Ever. Stokes walks off.    Randolph watches him disappear throu the mist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get yours, Frank! The rhino too! Do you hear me?! The wheels are turning! Stokes is gone. Randolph takes a swig from his flask and wipes his chin with his sleeve. He stares out at the river. RANDOLPH (quietly to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sooner or later, even a guy who's squeaky clean falls into mud. THUNDER CLAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the docks as Randolph stands alone before the river.

dialogues.speaker: SMOOCHY THE RHINO
dialogues.text: as it erratically limps forward before DROPPING OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind-up Smoochy lays upside-down on the carpet next to Nora's desk, legs grinding lamely in the air. Various Smoochy items are spread out on her desk top. A restless-looking Sheldon and a few members of Nora's staff are in on the meeting. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, these are just prototypes. I've been assured by FunZone that all the bugs will be worked out before Christmas. Sheldon raises his hand.   Nora ignores him and looks at her watch. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so let's recap before we break up... (refers to notes) Yes to the Smoochy ice pops. No to the Smoochy string cheese. And we're in a dick-measuring contest with Brown & Brown over the shampoo split. Sheldon suddenly stands up. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, time out, people! If I may interject, I think we're putting the cart before the horse here... Nora throws him an icy look.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoochy's still earning the trust of the kids. We don't want to compromise that by asking them to buy shampoo and cheese. How 'bout we just concentrate on doing the best show possible. Huh? Without all the bells and whistles and rickata-rackita. What do you say, guys? Nora casually picks up a Smoochy Frisbee from her desk and sails it toward the open door. It lands in the hallway. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (monotone) Oh, damn. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem, I'll get it. He walks out to the hallway. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to staffer) Shut the door please, John. John shuts the door. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now lock it. He locks it. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora emerges from the revolving door of the Kidnet building which is located in the heart of Times Square and heads down Broadway. Sheldon emerges from the building. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Nora, wait up. She keeps walking. Sheldon catches up and walks alongside her, occasionally getting jostled by passersby.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good meeting today. I thought we tackled some hot issues. Although, I'll be honest, there were a few times that I felt my voice wasn't being heard. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's a conservative estimate. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want the show to have some weight, you know? Some substance. Silly songs, sure -- but with a message. Pop quiz: How many original compositions are in the Smoochy songbook? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you sense my complete lack of interest? SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try two thousand. Covering every topic from how yummy vegetables are to the importance of donating plasma. Don't you get it, Nora? I'm a valuable resource. Use me. Nora stops.    She looks Sheldon in the eye for the first time. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I make this real easy for you? SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only reason you're on TV right now is because Rainbow Randolph is a degenerate scumbag. I didn't discover you, I delivered you. Like a bag of groceries. I have a bigger emotional investment in my nail polish. So don't peddle your sap to me, rhino. Your job is just to smile and nod your head. She walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon sits at the bar in the restaurant, nursing a drink and talking to the BARTENDER. He seems slightly drunk. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... No, no, you misunderstand me. It's not that I'm literally comparing Captain Kangaroo to Jesus Christ. I'm just saying that the Captain, like Christ, was someone you could believe in. Those guys didn't care about bells and whistles and rickita-rackata. It was all about the work. Especially Jesus. Forget about it. The Bartender nods and starts to pour Sheldon another drink. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving him off) That's okay, my good man.    Three's my limit. BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never saw anyone get loaded on orange juice before. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in my college days I could put away a carton of the stuff. A sharply-dressed man, BURKE BENNETT, sits down next to Sheldon. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bartender) Gimme a Five Crown. The Bartender nods.    He looks over at Sheldon. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoochy the Rhino.    Wow.   I'm a big fan. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flattered) Gee, thanks. I usually don't get recognized without my horn. Burke extends his hand. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke Bennett.    I represent kid show talent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon and Burke now sit at a corner table. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Shel, Frank Strokes ain't in the business to make you rich. He's in it to make Frank Stokes rich. That's how these network goons operate. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's so sad. Is it just me, or is that sad? BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, years ago, a client of mine, Dicky Gimble, was having a problem... SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you represented Dicky Gimble? BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, before the asshole found religion. Anyway, Stokes was trying to screw my boy out of some merchandising points. Claimed he had a warehouse full of Dicky dolls that weren't moving. Now Frank and I are old friends, so I say to him, 'Okay, cock, show me the warehouse' -- see, I know the fucking warehouse is in the Bronx, and I know it's emptier than my wife's head. (chuckles) To make a long story short, I walk out with a check for a hundred grand and Stokes is sitting there with his thumb up his ass. Burke laughs. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very amusing, but I don't care about Smoochy dolls and Smoochy floor wax... I just want more creative input. This rhino came from my womb. I bore him, I nursed him, and dammit... He pounds his fist on the table.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be the one who raises him! BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shel, it's all about the dough. After you get the money, you get the power. And after you get the power, you can have Smoochy walk on stage with a hard-on if you want. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's funny, that never crossed my mind. Burke downs the rest of his drink and stands up. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, until then... you're just another puppet in the prop room. He hands Sheldon his card. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a call when you're ready, kid. I'll cut the strings and open the magic door for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randolph peers through the restaurant's front window. He shivers from the cold as he watches Sheldon and Burke shake hands. Burke heads for the exit. Randolph quickly ducks into the shadows. A moment later, Burke exits the club and walks down the street. Randolph pops out. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you! I saw you in there... at my table... talking to him. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so what do you want?    A parade? RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my agent! Or did you forget that?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore, pal. You're a cigarette butt. Go lay in the gutter. Burke walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the litter-strewn alley, we PAN ACROSS several grocery bags, broken egg shells, flour bags, butter wrappers, mixing bowls and other baking ingredients. The PAN ENDS ON Randolph, who stands over a barrel fire, holding a spatula. A cookie sheet rests on the barrel. Randolph removes the cookie sheet and gazes at it gleefully. We now see that the cookies are phallic-shaped. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! They're beautiful! A perfect batch of cock cookies for a very special rhino. He sets the tray aside. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, you're going to learn about shame, my dear Smoochy.   And I'm your professor. He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's thirty minutes before a Smoochy taping. Dozens of giddy children are led into the studio where they take seats on the bleachers.

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE
dialogues.text: Sheldon, in the Smoochy costume, sans head, lumbers up to Nora. He holds a rundown for that day's show. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Nora. Why was the 'Please and Thank You Song' cut? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's sappy and it takes away from the 'Cookie Song.'

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes away? It enhances it! The cookie song is a meaningless piece of fluff without the 'Please and Thank You' coda! That's the moral anchor! That's where the lesson is! You can't sell the sizzle without the steak! NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cut. And I want the 'Cookie Song' lyrics changed back to the way they were originally scripted. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that. I will not condone children consuming endless amounts of refined sugar. I have to look myself in the mirror every morning. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is network television, not a sprout farm. We're here to sell sugar and plastic. That's what keeps the lights on. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're treating me like a puppet. You know that? Well, guess what? I am not your puppet. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when? Now get your spongy orange ass out there and dance for the cameras. An angry Sheldon storms off in frustration, but then stops. He looks back at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have different eyes, Nora. When I go out there I see kids. You see wallets with pigtails. He moves on. Nora stares at him as he walks away. He obviously got to her. As Sheldon heads toward the studio, he doesn't notice the two beady eyes staring at him from under the stairwell. After a beat, Randolph emerges and slinks backstage. He's clutching a duffle bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randolph sneaks into the prop room and shuts the door. He scurries over to the prop shelf and locates Smoochy's multicolored "magic cookie bag." He opens it and tosses the cookies into the trash can. Reaching into his pockets, he pulls out his special homemade cookies. He chuckles as he dumps them into the magic cookie bag. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bon soir, la Smoochy.   Welcome to fatty Arbuckle-land. He cackles to himself. He then notices a box in the corner of the room. Scribbled in magic marker on the side are the words: "Rainbow Randolph crap." He walks over and pulls the box out. He slowly opens the flaps. Inside is his old costume. He pulls it out and clutches it lovingly. He smells it. The ECHOEY SOUND of his THEME SONG comes flooding back to him for a moment, along with the sound of CHILDREN LAUGHING. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly to himself) Don't worry, little ones. Rainbow Randolph will return... (with rising anger) After these messages! He holds up Smoochy's magic cookie bag.   He then stuffs his old costume into his duffle bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "Smoochy Show" is in the middle of a taping. The Smoochyland Band is playing a fast, jazzy number ("Doin' the Jiggy Ziggy") as Smoochy, the Rhinettes, and several kids dance frenetically. The kids in the bleachers are in hysterics as Smoochy shakes his body spastically. The song finally ends. The kids in the bleachers jump to their feet, cheering and applauding. SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, all that jiggyin' and ziggyin' sure makes a fella hungry! Now if only I had my super duper, super secret, super special... The kids in the bleachers erupt in unison: KIDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magic Cookie Bag!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right-o-riffic! (looks skyward) Magic Cookie Bag, I command thee! Come to your lord and master! The lights dim as the Smoochyland Band plays the "2001 theme." Smoochy's Magic Cookie Bag is lowered from the ceiling by a filament wire. The kids go crazy. SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) 'Lookie, lookie, lookie, here comes the cookies! Fresh and organic, no need to panic! Right from the soil, no tropical oils! Sweetened with juice, for an energy boost! Fiber galore, you'll be askin' for more...'

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: She looks pissed, but then looks over at the kids in the bleachers. Their faces are filled with laughter. For the first time she feels the connection Smoochy has with them.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOLPH
dialogues.text: He peers out from his hiding place backstage. His eyes widen with delight as the Magic Cookie Bag continues its descent.

dialogues.speaker: SMOOCHY
dialogues.text: The cookie bag finally reaches Smoochy. He holds the bag high above his head in a religious ceremonial fashion as the Rhinettes and the kids crowd around him. SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh... just the smell of unprocessed flour makes my tummy do somersaults!

dialogues.speaker: RANDOLPH
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Whatever that means, you fucking retard.

dialogues.speaker: SMOOCHY
dialogues.text: His puffy orange hand reaches for the bag's clasp as the MUSIC reaches its CRESCENDO.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOLPH
dialogues.text: He's practically shaking as he suppresses an insane laugh. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give 'em a cookie... give 'em a cookie...

dialogues.speaker: SMOOCHY
dialogues.text: He reaches into the bag, and with a grand flourish, pulls out a flaming red penis cookie. The cookie is somewhat misshapen and not perfectly formed. Smoochy gets a big grin. SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! Look at this cookie, kids! A rocket ship! The kids "ooh" and "ahh."

dialogues.speaker: RANDOLPH
dialogues.text: He looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a special day with such special cookies!

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON SMOOCHY
dialogues.text: Smoochy pretends to "zoom" the penis cookie through the air. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rrrrrrrr! Look at me, kids! I'm flying to the moon! I'm flying to Mars! I'm flying to -- Randolph, whose face is now bright red, can't take it anymore. He runs onto the stage. He grabs the rocket cookie from Smoochy.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fucking blind?! It's a cock! Not a space ship! Cock! Cock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three burly Kidnet security guards drag Randolph down the stairwell. They beat the shit out of him and toss him through the exit door.

dialogues.speaker: PAGE
dialogues.text: The headline reads: "Rainbow Randolph Interrupts Smoochy Taping." The subhead reads: "Runs Onstage Shouting Penis Related Obscenities."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke sits on the couch next to Sheldon, reading the paper. He shakes his head in disgust. Nora sits in a chair near Stokes. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you all for coming. I just wanted to iron out a few wrinkles I feel we're having in the communication department. No finger-pointing. Lord knows when you start pointing fingers, someone gets poked in the eye. Sheldon laughs.    Stokes and Nora sit stone-faced. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyhoo, I'd like to turn the floor over to my new agent, Mr. Burke Bennett. So... heeeeeere's Burke! Sheldon applauds.    Burke stands. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you can imagine, my client has many concerns, not the least of which is studio security, but we can address that later. He pats Sheldon's head like a dog.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See this guy, Frank? Take a good long look, 'cause this prick saved your life. Without him you'd be sitting in Kaplan's right now, sucking club soda through a paper straw. (to Nora) And, you -- you'd be organizing puppet shows for the brats at P.S. 86. Excuse me, honey. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no excuse for you. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I love club soda. Sheldon laughs, trying to lighten the mood.       Burke g him an affectionate slap. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've always managed to come to some sort of arrangement, Burke. Why the fireworks? BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause I'm holding all the gunpowder. I represent the man who created, owns, and controls every square inch of Smoochy the Rhino. Burke pours himself a drink from Stokes' private bar. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God created Adam and what did he get? A fucking dud. My guy? He breathed life into a winner. And anyone who does a better job than God is gonna have a price. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke, of course, is in no way comparing me to God. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I am.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem to forget that we went out and found 'your guy.' Dug up his corpse. Handed him his own show when he couldn't sell his face to a photo booth. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be fair, Nora, I was booked to open a car wash in Montauk. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so you were doing him a favor? (chuckles) Allow me to untangle this web of shit! I don't care what his resume was, I don't care where you found him, I don't care if his last job was juggling apples for a hut full of Pygmies on the outskirts of the Congo... the fact is, he fits a bill and you need him. Like a hungry baby needs a big tit. And that, my friends, is why you're in a box with no ventilation. And that is why the rhino is going to get what he deserves. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that, exactly? Burke walks over to Stokes' desk and leans across it. He's an inch from Stokes' face. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heaven, hell, and everything in between.

dialogues.speaker: CORK
dialogues.text: being popped as foamy champagne runs down the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon and Burke sit at a table in the nightclub.    Bur raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the star and new executive producer of the Smoochy show! May your reign be a long and healthy one! They clink glasses. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still in shock. Complete creative control, part ownership of the show, discretion over merchandising and a dressing room with a toilet! Am I dreaming or what? BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't forget the corporate penthouse. It took me six years to get that for Randolph. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, imagine... me, living in a penthouse. Who'd a thunk it. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called the high life, kid. Get used to it. Pretty soon you'll be burnin' one hundred dollar bills just to see Franklin break a sweat. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, I hope not. I have a deep respect for money. Not to mention Ben Franklin who had some remarkable achievements in his lifetime. Burke pulls out a paper bag and hands it to Sheldon. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this? BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your graduation present. Something you're gonna need now. Sheldon reaches in the bag and pulls out a revolver. He recoils in horror and immediately drops it back in the bag.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of it as a tool of the trade. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never owned a gun, I've never touched a gun, and I don't believe in guns. When I played cowboys and Indians as a kid, I was always the Chinese railroad worker. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, Shel. It's a handy accessory in this business. Even if you don't load it, have it for show. Sometimes that's all you need. Especially with a creep like Randolph lurking around. Burke and Sheldon look up and notice the hulking, grinning figure of SPINNER DUNN standing over them. Spinner has the smile of a little boy despite his crooked nose and scarred face. He extends his hand. SPINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, Smoochy! I'm Spinner! Spinner! SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there. SPINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so excited to meet you!    I'm Spinner! Spinner's massive hand engulfs Sheldon's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remembers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... right. I saw you fight on TV once. I think it was your farewell bout.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Through a SERIES OF CUTS we see Spinner getting pummeled in various fights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight marks Spinner Dunn's final appearance in the ring. What a pleasure it's been to watch him proudly march into the record books for taking more blows to the head than any fighter in history. A bloodied, defeated Spinner happily holds up the arm of his opponent after a match. He then hugs the referee. He jumps down from the ring and hugs the three judges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrambled a bit? Sure. You don't retire with a record of 81-59 and wind up the Governor. But on the upside, he's got the disposition of a collie. Spinner wades into the stands and starts hugging the spectators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spinner is still pumping Sheldon's hand. SPINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I love, Smoochy? I love when you do the Jiggy Ziggy dance! You know, the one you do during 'Silly Time?' SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet.     That's a big one. SPINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna see me do it? SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know why if there's enough room here to... Spinner starts Jiggying and Ziggying for Sheldon. He bangs into a table and knocks over someone's drink. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, champ, don't get overheated. Spinner stops, out of breath.       He leans over and hug Sheldon.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SPINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... uh... love you, too, Spinner. A powerful-looking woman, TOMMY COTTER, calls to Spinner from the bar. TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spinner, come over and meet the Senator! Spinner dutifully hurries over to Tommy. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems pretty popular. It must take real talent to run a place like this. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spinner? The guy couldn't run a water faucet. He's just a mascot. It's his cousins, a bunch of Irish mob boys, who really run the joint.

dialogues.speaker: SPINNER
dialogues.text: He shakes the Senator's hand as Tommy and a few other tough Irish guys stand around. Spinner looks over towards Sheldon. SPINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly) Don't go anywhere, Smoochy! I'll be right back after I take a dump! Spinner releases the Senator's hand and rushes off. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you made a new friend, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We met him backstage with Smoochy... innocent face... Angelo stirs a pot of soup in the worn-down but tidy apartment. A "Rhinette" costume is draped over one of the chairs. There is a sudden LOUD POUNDING on the door. Angelo puts the spoon down and reaches behind some spices on the shelf above. He pulls out a revolver. The POUNDING continues. ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, who is it? RANDOLPH (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (friendly) Open up, buddy! It's me, Randolph! It's been a long time! Angelo puts the gun in his waistband and walks to the door. He slowly slides the chain off and opens the door a crack. Peering in at him are the bloodshot eyes of Rainbow Randolph. ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy? Randolph suddenly kicks the door open and tackles Angelo. Randolph sits on top of the little man. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking traitor! My body's barely cold and already you work for the rhino? ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie to me! I heard all about it! You strapped that horn on faster than a cheerleader gets the clap! ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta eat, don't I? RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a Krinkle Kid!   Not a Smooch-bag! Say it! ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhinette!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it: I am a Krinkle Kid! Say it, before God! On the soul of Jesus Christ! Say what you are! Angelo punches Randolph in the mouth and flips him over. He now sits on Randolph, pointing the revolver to his fac ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a Rhinette. Got that? The Krinkle Kids are ten feet under. With you. Randolph starts crying like a child. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blubbering) I missed you so much. Can I stay here? I got no place to go. Angelo sighs and puts the gun away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angelo and Randolph sit at the small kitchen table. Angelo watches as Randolph ravenously eats a bowl of soup. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... They kicked me out of the corporate penthouse. Big surprise. Sons-a-bitches. That's how I got this beauty. He points to a nasty bump near his eye. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And of course, there's this... He yanks his lip back to reveal a missing tooth. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That happened after my little visit to the studio the other day. Network security. Fucking savages. He slurps another spoonful of soup and spits a bay leaf on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got liens, back taxes, lawyer's bills, threats against my life... I basically got the whole fucking world up my ass. It's okay, I got a loooong memory, son. (Amos and Andy dialect) What dey sow, dey gonna reap. He cackles insanely as he picks up a bottle of gin and takes a deep swig. He passes out and falls off the chair. Angelo leans down and lifts his head off the floor. ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop doing this to yourself! Randolph doesn't respond.    Angelo slaps his face. ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wise up! You hear me? Don't piss your life away like this. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half-conscious) It's the rhino, Angie. He's been sent by the devil. Sent from hell to destroy me. Smoochy... is the face of evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are ON the smiling goofy face of Sheldon, whose picture graces the front page of Variety under the headline, "MOPES TO EXECUTIVE PRODUCE SMOOCHY SHOW." The subhead reads, "TENURE TO BEGIN TODAY." A dollar bill is slapped down over the picture. We WIDEN OUT to see Sheldon buying the magazine at the newsstand in front of the Kidnet Building. He turns and walks toward the Kidnet entrance. He stops and looks up at the building. Smiling, he takes a deep breath and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon whistles as he walks down the hall, giving cheerful "hellos" and "good mornings" along the way.   He enters Nora's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora is on the phone. She pretends not to notice him. Sheldon bides his time by inspecting knickknacks, examining photos on the wall, etc. Finally, he half- whispers/half-mouths to her: SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever you get a chance... I just need a second. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Listen, can I call you back? Yeah, some asshole's screaming in my ear. Thanks. She hangs up. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, you didn't have to hang up. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I didn't you'd still be here. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I am still here. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hoping to correct that. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora, I want us to start off on the right foot. I want you to know that I value your input and I don't want you to feel intimidated just because the power structure has changed a bit. I consider you a partner. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. That'll come in handy if we're ever at a square dance. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was never much of the do- se-do type, but what I would love to do is take you out to lunch one day. You know, just two colleagues chewing the fat... forming a mutual respect... planting the seeds of cooperation...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair enough. If you change your mind -- NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't. Sheldon just nods and starts to exit. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay then, I'll be in my office if you need me. If you want to brainstorm about anything. Ideas and so forth. He passes a plant by the door. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ficus? She ignores him.      He exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon walks slowly down the hallway.     He no longer h a bounce in his step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon enters his plush new office, awkwardly walks over to his new desk and sits behind it for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My cousin Spinner's take quite a shine to you. Sheldon jumps. He's surprised to Tommy from Spinner Dunn's restaurant. Tommy's crew, ROY, DANNY, JIMMY and SAMMY occupy the sofa. TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever since you came in the restaurant. He can't stop yakkin'.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's a very nice man. Very sweet disposition for someone that size. TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I was wondering if maybe you could give him a little floor space. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry? TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, a little part on the show. You're the executive producer now. You call the shots, right? SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, that's a very sweet offer, and I love Spinner, but TV is a complicated medium and... I mean, that would be like me getting into the ring with a prizefighter. (laughs) Can you imagine such a thing? Boom. K.O.! What's the alphabet, Mommy? Sheldon laughs again.       Tommy gets quiet. TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This makes me sad.    Very, very, sad. DANNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Tommy? TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.     I'm just very sad right now. SAMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who made you sad, Tommy? TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to mention names. The guys look menacingly at Sheldon. They rise and walk around his desk until they're on either side of him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? Maybe I can find Spinner a little something to do on the show. That's probably the best solution. Tommy now smiles and walks over to Sheldon.       She mus Sheldon's hair. TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good boy, Mopes. Don't think we don't remember favors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon is in a meeting with a man, SONNY GORDON. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I appreciate the visit, but I'm just putting together a little petting zoo segment. Nothing fancy -- a few kittens... maybe a duck...

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL 358
dialogues.text: SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're looking to bring in that many pieces I gotta put a crew together. Plus, we're lookin' at transpo, a few leash handlers, a cleanup boy and a doper to keep the inventory quiet. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeez, this all sounds awfully elaborate. I might have to forgo the union and just borrow a few animals from a pet shop. SONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't recommend it. Miss Carol from Romper Room tried that once and she's still limping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frazzled-looking Sheldon is meeting with BEN FRANKS. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On behalf of FunZone Toys, I'd like to congratulate you on your recent promotion, and present you with a small gift.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: Ben reaches into his breast pocket and drops a large wad of money on Sheldon's desk that lands with a thud. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... that's nice of you, Ben, but a card would have been fine. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FunZone Toys would very much like the Smoochy contract, Mr. Mopes. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this... I mean... are you offering me a bribe or something? BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FunZone Toys would very much like the Smoochy contract, Mr. Mopes. Sheldon picks up the money and tosses it back to Ben. Sheldon rises from his desk. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally, sir, we take the trash out at the end of the day, but I think I'll make an exception in your case. Sheldon escorts Ben out the door and slams it shut.   The PHONE RINGS. Sheldon walks over and picks it up. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? ASSISTANT (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Mr. Feedlepepper on line two. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? ASSISTANT (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he's an old friend. Sheldon punches line two.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better grow eyes on the back of your fucking head, you horned piece of shit! I won't sleep until the worms are crawlin' up your foam rubber ass! I'm going on safari, motherfucker... safari! Sheldon hangs up stunned.       Nora walks in holding the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations on your little ice show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't take you long to sell out, did it? She tosses the paper on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your precious integrity? Or was that just part of your dog and pony act. She exits.    A confused Sheldon looks at the "Around Tow column.

dialogues.speaker: HEADLINE
dialogues.text: "GARDEN TO HOST SMOOCHY ON ICE."      The subhead reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are TIGHT ON the feet of an Irish dancer doing a sort of Riverdance. We WIDEN OUT and the rest of the dancers come INTO FRAME. Spinner and the mob ar clapping and whooping. Sheldon and Burke sit at a table in the dark club having a conversation. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke, I never agreed to do an ice show. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shel, do you know what kind of cash we'll take in between the gate and concessions? A venture like this gets you money and muscle. Times twenty. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice shows represent everything I'm against. They're mindless spectacles whose main purpose is to sell overpriced sugar-water and cheap plastic toys that splinter in a kid's mouth on the ride home. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know you got this fetish for ethics, but now's not the time to fly that kite. No one's ever refused a shot at an ice show. Sheldon tears the contract in half. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until now. Smoochy doesn't sell out, Burke. You should be proud of that. Proud that you represent a client who paves driveways, not paints them over. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thrilled, Shel. Knocked out. Burke just sits there, stunned.   A waitress, SANDY, passes by the booth. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have a pineapple juice, Sandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pineapple? What happened to orange juice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm feeling feisty tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are now on a drum solo. Ernie the Elephant of the Smoochyland Band works it. The animal band plays a sloppy version of "Pop Goes the Weasel." End on Spinner Dunn -- the newest and by far largest member of the band. Spinner holds s cowbell and seems to be concentrating intently on the proper moment to hit it. Unfortunately, his rhythm is off, which throws the rest of the band off as well. We WIDEN OUT to see Smoochy and the Rhinettes attempting to dance to the off-kilter rhythm. The song finally ends. The Rhinettes glare at Spinner. Smoochy addresses the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, wasn't that fun? In an awkward kind of way? Anyhoo, how 'bout a big round of applause for the newest member of the Smoochyland Band... former heavyweight contender, Spinner Dunn! Spinner stands up to take a bow and almost knocks the entire bandstand over. There is a smattering of confused applause from the kids in the bleachers. Spinner drops the cowbell and it clangs on the studio floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.   Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beaming Spinner runs up to Sheldon, who's still in costume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I do good, Sheldon, huh?   Did I do good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that was great, Spinner. Just watch your elbow next time. Pinky's probably gonna lose that tooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okey doke.   I'm gonna go get drunk now. Spinner skips off humming "Pop Goes the Weasel" and banging his cowbell. Nora passes Sheldon backstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice job. Casting the show with mental patients, I like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is not a mental patient. He's an ex-boxer and nightclub owner who happens to have the sweet innocent brian of a five-year-old!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me for not making the distinction. She leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon exits the Kidnet building and walks to the curb to hail a cab. A friendly-looking man in a suit and bow tie approaches him. This is MERV GREEN. MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. A limo pulls up in front of them.     Merv opens the back door. MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks anyway, but I'm going uptown.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Merv pulls his jacket back to reveal a revolver tucked in his waistband. MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humor me, rhino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon slides into the back seat of the limo. A big thug in an overcoat, HENRY, is already sitting there. Merv gets in behind him and shuts the door. Sheldon is now wedged between the two men as the limo heads down Broadway. Merv extends his hand. MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merv Green, Sheldon. It's a pleasure to meet you. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're hoping for an autograph, the gun's a bit much. The whole 'catch more flies with honey' thing -- it really holds water. Sheldon laughs nervously. MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon, I represent the Parade of Hope Foundation. Maybe you've heard of us. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You raise money to build children's hospitals, right? MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been known to add a brick or two, sure. Merv and the thug laugh. MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon, let me get right to the point -- there's talk on the street that you're pulling out of the ice show. Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHELDON (big sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I never agreed to an ice show, nor would I ever agree to do an ice show, and let me add that none of this is your concern, sir. (shakes his head) Sheesh. MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen carefully, son: Parade of Hope has sponsored every Kidnet ice show since 1964. We take a piece off the top and everybody walks away happy. So let's not buck history. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I appreciate the offer, but for the gazillionth time, I'm not doing an ice show, so we have nothing to discuss. Now, if you'll just pull over, I'll get out and we'll say our toodley-dos. (to driver) Far corner, please. MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allow me to be less murky. Starting tomorrow, Smoochy the Rhino raises his baton for Parade of Hope. Benefits, banquets, fund-raisers, I want it all. (to driver) Pull over, Terry. The car pulls to the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as far as the ice show goes... I recommend you start shopping for skates. The door pops open and Sheldon is tossed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A troubled-looking Sheldon stands on his balcony looking out at the city. He drinks orange juice straight from the carton. Sheldon is on the phone with Burke. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is unacceptable, Burke!    I'm calling the authorities. BURKE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it, Shel. You rat on Parade of Hope and you'll be lucky if they find your toenails. These guys are the roughest of all the charities. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was threatened by an organization that's supposed to help children! What kind of world is this? BURKE (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real one. My advice? Consider the ice show and stay healthy. Burke hangs up. After a beat, Sheldon's DOORBELL RINGS. He walks over to the door and opens it. To his surprise, Nora is standing there. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I come in? SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Nora enters. She seems a little wobbly.    Sheldon notice she's holding a pint of whiskey. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... are you okay? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting drunk and I'm not used to it. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, not to make you feel worse, but with alcohol you're also consuming empty calories. Nora looks at him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that... I want to apologize, actually. And on those rare occasions when I feel the need to apologize for something, it helps if I'm, you know... shit- faced. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.   I'm honored. Nora trips slightly.     Sheldon takes the whiskey from h SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we get some air? He leads her out on the balcony.    They look out at the city. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I may have been a little harsh when we spoke the other day. A little out of line. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it wasn't as bad as the week before when you called me a pasty- faced, no-talent hack. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that was probably insensitive as well. (looks at him) I heard you're not doing the ice show. I find that... incredibly admirable. Why didn't you tell me? SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I didn't want to spoil your fun. You look so content when you're berating me. Nora looks down. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I have become a bit hardened over the years. Sincerity's an easy disguise in this business. It's hard to know who's on the level.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, I'm learning that more and more every day. (wistfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Sometimes light is really dark, Sometimes crows can sing like larks Sometimes Winter feels like Spring, Don't think you know everything.' NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in disbelief) 'Rickets the Hippo'? SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember Rickets? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my favorite show when I was a kid. Rickets was the one face I knew I could trust. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how I felt! Rickets had real depth. He was my inspiration for Smoochy. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? He was my inspiration to work in children's television. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it. I never met anyone who even remembers Rickets. Do you remember the Klunky-Wunky dance? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember it?   I did it at my first communion. Sheldon starts doing the rather insane-looking Klunky- Wunky dance. Nora does it with him. They both stop and look at each other. Sheldon impulsively leans in and kisses her. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. That was a mistake, right? I didn't mean for that to hap-- Nora grabs his head and pulls it toward her.       They b kissing passionately.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they kiss) You're not full of shit like all the others, are you? SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they kiss) You're for real, right? SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the kisses) I mean, I couldn't tell... First I thought it was an act... and then I just thought you were a simp or something... SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh... you don't have to explain... They continue to kiss.      Nora abruptly stops. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should go. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Nora exits the balcony and collects her coat and purse. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? Is it the whiskey? If you have to throw up, be my guest. Anywhere you like. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just getting late. Sheldon follows her to the door. She stops and looks at him for a moment. The PHONE starts to RING. Neither of them says anything for a beat. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better get that.    Good night. She exits. Sheldon shuts the door and sighs. He goes to the bar to pour himself another orange juice before picking up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELO'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: We GO TO a HORIZONTAL SPLIT-SCREEN. Randolph is on the BOTTOM HALF. He lies on his bed in Angelo's apartment wearing a bathrobe with a towel wrapped around his head. His head dangles off the bed as he talks on the phone. The SHOT is reminiscent of Bye Bye Birdie. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Mopes? My name is Benjamin Kunklepeck and I'm calling on behalf of 'Parents for Decency in Children's Television,' perhaps you've heard of us? SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I like where you're coming from. It's an issue very close to my heart. Why just yesterday I was commenting -- RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we're having a banquet tomorrow and we'd be honored to have you perform for us. We would also like to present you with a plaque for your ongoing commitment to children's television. The presenter will be a young orphan with mild asthma. Can you attend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black Lincoln Town Car travels across the bridge toward Staten Island. SHELDON (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for picking me up, Mr. Kunklepeck. It's very nice of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon is in the back seat. The Smoochy costume is next to him. Behind the wheel is Randolph. He's in disguise.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be silly. The chance to have Smoochy the Rhino perform at our little soiree? I'd carry you piggy-back through a bed of hot rusty glass if I had to. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's always a pleasure to help out a worthy cause. And believe me, I've learned lately that it's not all sunshine and daffodils in the land of non- profit. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just looove your show, by the way. It's such a refreshing change of pace from that dreadful embezzler... what's his name again? Rainbow something or other? SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randolph. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Rainbow Randolph. What a scoundrel! He's probably gay too. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know. I feel sorry for him, actually. He obviously has problems or issues that he needs to sort out. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting frustrated) Yeah, yeah, yeah, but don't you take particular glee in that you basically stole his time slot? Helped shovel dirt onto his miserable corpse, as it were? SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I would never take pleasure in someone's downfall. You know the old expression about walking a mile in another man's shoes? Well, that really holds water. Just try to imagine --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping) Come on, he's a fucking asshole! You hate him! Admit it! SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Uh... can we listen to the radio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Town Car is parked behind an old warehouse in the middle of nowhere. Sheldon is now in costume. Randolph rushes out of the door, very excited. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, they're ready for you! SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta say, this is a first -- I never performed in a tractor parts warehouse before. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we like to do these things no-frills. It's all about the kids. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen to that. Randolph opens the door a crack and listens.      We hear O.S. VOICE from inside. VOICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gives me great pleasure to introduce our very special guest... a supporter of the cause and a friend to the brotherhood. Please welcome, the one, the only... Smoochy the Rhino! We hear APPLAUSE.    Randolph quickly opens the rusty doo RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock 'em dead, kid! He shoves Sheldon inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon runs in and immediately starts singing and dancing on the makeshift stage.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Well, how-do-you-do, my   good friends! How do-you-do,    my pals! It's so nice to see good   friends! Sing along with me now!    How do you do, my good -- ' Sheldon abruptly stops singing as a look of shock comes over him. PUSH IN ON his troubled face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several hundred men in Nazi uniforms in a warehouse draped in swastikas. They all start chanting: NAZIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heil Smoochy!    Heil Smoochy!   Heil Smoochy! A huge swastika banner unfurls behind Smoochy, framing him like Patton in front of the American flag. Flashbulbs go off. The "Heil Smoochys" continue. A GERMAN MARCH starts to BLARE from the SPEAKERS. Looking stunned, Sheldon slowly leans into the mic. He clears his throat. The MUSIC STOPS. Everyone quiets down. He searches for just the right words, and finally... SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my sincere hope that I'm dreaming right now, but in the event that I'm not... what's the deal with the swastikas? Suddenly, a sea of policemen bursts into the warehouse. LEAD COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an unlawful assembly, you kraut sons-a-bitches! You're all under arrest! Pandemonium ensues us all the Nazis run for cover. Sheldon stands in the middle of it all, unsure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon is led from the warehouse in handcuffs and is barraged with questions from waiting REPORTERS. Flashbulbs go off as they shout out questions.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: REPORTER #1
