dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you officially a member of the Aryan Brotherhood, Sheldon? REPORTER #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true you consider Adolph Hitler your personal hero? REPORTER #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think associating with neo- Nazis might adversely affect your career? REPORTER #4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it feel to be a hate- filled racist scumbag? SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a mix-up! I'm innocent! I don't hate anyone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that mean you don't hate Nazis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!   I didn't say that!   I -- Sheldon is shoved into the back seat of a squad car. drives off, SIRENS BLARING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The squad car drives through Times Square. The headlines on the zipper marquee GLIDE THROUGH the FRAME: "Smoochy the Rhino Arrested at Nazi Rally... Cops Raid Warehouse During Rhino's Performance... Aryan Brotherhood Declares Smoochy 'One of us.'... President Condemns 'Smoochy the Fascist'..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon stares out the window as the dark city passes by. We SLOWLY MOVE IN ON his eyes as we...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: In SLOW MOTION, Smoochy dances in the studio while holding a delighted little girl in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE PRECINCT
dialogues.text: Sheldon is fingerprinted and photographed.

dialogues.speaker: AFRICAN JUNGLE
dialogues.text: STOCK FOOTAGE of a wild rhinoceros being shot by hunters.

dialogues.speaker: STUDIO C
dialogues.text: Smoochy's Magic Jungle is dismantled.

dialogues.speaker: SUBURBAN DRIVEWAY
dialogues.text: A young Sheldon helps his grandfather spread black paint on a driveway.

dialogues.speaker: TIMES SQUARE
dialogues.text: The Smoochy billboard is torn down.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK LIMBO
dialogues.text: The Smoochy costume is in flames.    It slowly burns to ashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kidnet CEO stands before a cluster of reporters and network cameras. We can see the Times Square zipper marquee THROUGH the glass doors behind him. Headlines read: "Congressional Committee Probes Nazi Ties to Kid Biz"... "Smoochy Photos Removed From City Elementary Schools"... "Jewish Groups Plan 'Day of Outrage'"... "Rhino in Bronx Zoo Pelted With Eggs"... CEO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here at Kidnet, Smoochy the Rhino is now Smoochy the Ghost. We have excised that particular malignancy from our network and will seek out a suitable replacement. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CEO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until then, the Smoochy slot will be safely occupied by Popeye cartoons. Thank you. The reporters furiously scribble down his statement. END OF MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randolph dances down the street like Gene Kelly. He whistles a happy tune and tips his hat to everyone who walks by. As he dances along, he pets a dog... RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there, poochy! Coos at a baby in a stroller... RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, aren't you the cutest little boo-boo in the world! And grabs a rose from a flower vendor before handing it to an old lady... RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you, my dear!   May you live to be a hundred! He continues to dance onward, waving back at everyone. Unfortunately, he doesn't realize he's heading straight for a light pole and slams into it with a sickening smack. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora exits the revolving door of the Kidnet building and heads down Broadway. Sheldon pops out from a store front. He's wearing a knit cap and sunglasses to disguise himself. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to talk to you. Nora keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have nothing to talk about. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you believe what they're saying! NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to believe anyone. The picture in the paper said it all. No one forced you to perform at that rally. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perform?     I barely sang one song. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well maybe next time you'll do a longer set. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora, I had no idea that was a Nazi function. None whatsoever! NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, you'd think the fifty-foot swastika you were standing in front of might've given you a hint. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The papers are blowing that out of proportion. It was nowhere near that big. Nora stops and looks Sheldon in the eye. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the fact of the matter is, I don't know you, okay? Not really. So don't expect me to go out on an emotional limb here. Sheldon looks crushed. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about the balcony? What about the Klunky-Wunky dance? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was drunk.    Don't read too much into it. She looks at him for a moment and then walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A disheveled and unshaven Sheldon wanders the streets, looking dazed. He's stuffing a cupcake into his mouth and swigging from a bottle of root beer. He passes a construction site and notices some graffiti on a wall -- a crudely-drawn goose-stepping Smoochy in a Nazi uniform and Hitler moustache. Sheldon keeps walking. He descends the subway stairs at 42nd Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon comes up from the subway.    We see the Cyclone from Astroland in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon stands in front of the methadone clinic he used to perform at. It's boarded up. He just stares at it. An OLD VAGRANT walks up to him. OLD VAGRANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're lookin' to get a cup of juice, the well's dried up, son. City shut her down. Bastards'll put a new pair of tits on the Statue of Liberty, but they won't help a poor hophead. The Vagrant shakes his head sadly. OLD VAGRANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just once I wish I had a little clout. You know? I'd set things straight in this town, believe me. (sighs) Hell of a world. He walks off. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Hell of a world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a large screen TV the smiling Asian face of Takashi Yamashita, who's singing Cole Porter's "I Get a Kick Out of You" in Japanese. CUT BACK to reveal Takashi wearing a white sequined tuxedo with tails as he plays a white grand piano. He looks like an Asian Liberace. He is circled by a group of Japanese children who sing along with him. CHICK (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Takashi Sings Tin Pan Alley for Youngsters' is the hottest show on Japanese television. The sweat shops are working overtime trying to keep up with the demand. Record albums, toys, cereal, tee shirts, you name it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several tough-looking Asian men -- CHICK, SAMBO, and TOBI -- Takashi's management group -- sits in Stokes' office. Takashi sits quietly in the corner. Stokes sits behind his desk, sipping his trademark glass of wine. CHICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Stokes, let's cut the bullshit. We want Takashi in that Smoochy slot and we're willing to do whatever it takes to get it. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me for saying this, but for a non-resident of this country, you speak impeccable English. CHICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm originally from Teaneck. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. CHICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We own every hair on this bastard's head and we're willing to share a few strands... if you get my drift. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not that simple. I have an executive board to answer to. I wish I could just snap my fingers and make a deal but --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CHICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like this? Chick snaps his fingers and Tobi, the third Asian guy, walks over and drops a duffel bag on Stokes' desk. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my.   And what is this on my desk? CHICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred grand in a Louis Vuitton duffle bag. Get our boy the slot and we'll round it off to a million. And you can keep the luggage. Stokes stares down at the bundle of opportunity on his desk. CHICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dealing with an honorable culture, Frank. We know how to play ball. Stokes unzips the bag and gazes at the money.     He look up at Chick and smiles. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, I suddenly feel invigorated and full of hope. Chick smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Nora's TV screen, we see the black and white image of Rickets the Hippo doing the "Klunky-Wunky Dance." Nora sits on the couch and stares hypnotically at the screen. There is a KNOCK at the door. She gets up and ejects the "Best of Rickets" tape. She opens the door. To her surprise, Randolph is standing there. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, cutie! Before she can respond, he enters the apartment and takes off his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So here's the good news: Yes, I'll be happy to end my sabbatical and return to my old slot. I know you and Frank are in a bind, so I'll start Monday. Call wardrobe, call props, tell 'em the R man is back and he's ready to start whistlin' dem happy tunes for da little chillens. He flops down on the couch. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh. Who do ya gotta blow to get a Scotch around here? He laughs. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got three seconds to pry your ass off my couch and get out. Randolph jumps to his feet. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit, Nora! The rhino's gone! You need that slot filled and I'm ready to reclaim what's rightfully mine. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just in case you forgot, you're a criminal and a scumbag. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so maybe I commandeered a stray shekel or two. Big deal! Compared to what Smoochy did that's like jerking off in the supermarket. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you shop? Randolph walks over and puts his hands on her shoulders. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Have you lost all affection for me? After what we once had?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a long time ago.    I was young and stupid. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why we broke up I'll never know. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You turned into an asshole and I didn't love you. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could've worked through all that. He leans in to kiss her and she shoves him away so violently he almost falls over the coffee table. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, Nora! The public is clamoring for me! I'm a fucking patriot! Mopes is a Nazi! He's evil! He's probably even gay! You should've seen the way he was checking me out in the car! NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly suspicious) What does that mean? RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does what mean? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said he was checking you out in the car. What car? RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... it's just a vibe! A Nazi homosexual vibe! It emanates from the television! The whole Smoochy costume... with the erect horn... I mean, what's that all about? Nora starts to walk closer to him.       He backs up. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking awfully fast, Randolph. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still love you!   Let's go on a date!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you at that rally? Tell me! Did you have something to do with this? She backs him against the wall and looks him in the eye. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you set Sheldon up? Randolph just looks at her. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, now I remember why we broke up. Always with the accusations. Bitch, bitch, bitch... Nora hauls off and punches him in the jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A morose-looking Spinner Dunn sits alone at the end of the bar in the nightclub. Tommy walks over. TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, kid? The mayor of Patterson's here with his wife. They wanna meet ya. SPINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna meet no one. I miss Smoochy! He never woulda done the things they say he done. He ain't no Nazi. Someone's making stuff up. I just know it, Tommy. Someone's making stuff up! Spinner starts violently pounding his head on the bar, causing GLASSES to RATTLE. SPINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want Smoochy back! I want to be on TV again! I want to play my cowbell! Nora enters the restaurant.    She looks around and approaches Tommy. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Tommy. Hi, Spinner.   Has Burke been in tonight?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't seen him. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it. TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something I can help you with? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to talk to him.    It's about Sheldon. Spinner lifts his head from the bar. SPINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon?     What about Sheldon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randolph is napping on Angelo's couch with an ice pack on his sore jaw thanks to Nora's fist. There is a sudden LOUD POUNDING at the door. Randolph startles awake. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to sleep, asshole! Read the fucking meter some other time! After a beat, the door is kicked open and Tommy and his crew are standing there. TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna tell me about the rhino? RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, this is private property, creep! And you're trespassing! TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny, go give Mr. Smiley a little back rub. Danny advances toward a shaking Randolph, fist clenched and rolling up his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: approaches. He cocks his arm and throws a punch. Danny's fist FILLS the FRAME, TURNING IT BLACK as we hear the PUNCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newspaper trucks pull up to various newsstands and toss out bundles of the morning editions. As each bundle lands on the curb, we see headlines that span over the next few days:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randolph, bruised and battered, emerges from the police station with his LAWYER. REPORTERS and photographers rush forward. REPORTER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it feel to be voted the most hated man in America, Randolph? RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a country like this, where your average citizen is a fuckin' Neanderthal, I wear it as a badge of honor. REPORTER #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Ms. Bishop's charge that you have an unhealthy obsession with Sheldon Mopes? RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I barely know that broad. She's a wacko. An opportunist. I'm the most accused man since Jimmy Hoffa. Someone throws an egg and it hits Randolph in the face. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on verge of tears) That was unfair! Who threw that? That was mean and uncalled for!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My client is not answering any more questions. Between his dwindling cash flow and mounting legal bills he's sinking into a deep psychotic depression. Please stop antagonizing him. Thank you. He pushes a sullen Randolph through the cluster of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A makeup woman dabs Sheldon's forehead as he's about to go on. Nora stands next to him. A LOW TYMPANY ROLL is heard from the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nora)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be back here if it wasn't for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just sorry I didn't believe you... that I got swept up in the frenzy of anti-Smoochyism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this town's a house of mirrors sometimes. It's hard to know what you're looking at. He takes a couple of pre-show deep breaths.      A STAGEH approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're ready for you, Sheldon. Sheldon exits backstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights in the studio dim. ANNOUNCER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen... boys and girls... (dramatic pause) Who's your favorite rhino? An explosion of enthusiasm from the kids in the bleachers.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KIDS IN BLEACHERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoochy!!! The lights come up as the Smoochyland Band plays a strong, dramatic version of "Battle Hymn of the Republic." After a moment, Smoochy slowly rises from a lift under the stage. A giant sign above the jungle lights up and emits a pyrotechnic shower of sparks. It reads: WELCOME HOME SMOOCHY!

dialogues.speaker: SMOOCHYLAND BAND
dialogues.text: A beaming Spinner Dunn enthusiastically bangs his cowbell to the music as tears stream down his cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON SMOOCHY
dialogues.text: He majestically stands center stage and nods to the kids who are giving him a standing ovation. The song crescendos with a rousing final chorus from the Smoochyland Band who sing, "His truth is marching on!" Thunderous applause from the bleachers. Smoochy walks over to a stool and takes a seat. It's very quiet in the studio now. Smoochy, looking uncharacteristically serious, picks up a microphone as the lights go down. He's in black limbo. SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. It's good to be back. You know, kids, sometimes life in the jungle can be unfair. A place where nice guys don't just finish last... they get their heads cut off. Gasps from the bleachers. SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That pretty world you think you know is just props and scenery. Lollipop trees with roots in venom!

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: watches nervously from offstage.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON SMOOCHY
dialogues.text: SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So look around you, boys and girls. Every day. Be diligent! Stand strong! As the old proverb says: Beat a dog one time too many and you get a wolf! Let's start howling! Howl for me, boys and girls! The kids in the bleachers howl along with Smoochy. SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I just wanted to get that off my chest. Who wants to do the Hokey-Pokey?! The kids cheer as the Smoochyland Band launches into the Hokey-Pokey song and Smoochy starts dancing. The kids pour out of the bleachers onto the jungle set. Everyone is dancing and having a ball. Nora is clapping to the music offstage. Sheldon and Nora exchange affectionate glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randolph sits in front of the TELEVISION in a daze. He's wearing a ratty bathrobe and absentmindedly tosses cheese curls onto the floor from a bag on his lap. ON the TV, an "Entertainment Tonight"-type show with two perky hosts is covering Smoochy's return to the airwaves. The hosts, Tara and Hunter show Smoochy's dynamic entrance and the standing ovation he got during the taping that day. TARA (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Smoochy's back and boy did we miss him. Hundreds of well- wishers stood outside Kidnet Studios today hoping to catch a glimpse of their favorite rhino. HUNTER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Tara. Smoochy's popularity is stronger than ever thanks to his recent exoneration as a Nazi sympathizer. In fact, several movie studios are offering big bucks for a chance to bring the Smoochy story to the silver screen...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The BROADCAST CONTINUES. Smoochy images flash across the screen. Randolph has been mumbling the whole time. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly to himself) Bad... very bad... too much for brain... pressure building... ears ringing... eyes burning... contempt overflowing... He jumps up and kicks the TV over.    He picks up a lamp and starts beating the TV. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you! I fucking hate you!!! You devil-horned mind fucker! Die, die, die!! Angelo, who was cooking in the kitchen, runs out.       H wearing an apron. ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! That's a Zenith! (notices cheese curls) Look at this place! He grabs the lamp from Randolph. ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! I want you out of here! RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly scared) Where am I supposed to go? ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care! (pointing to door) Out!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spinner's massive arms envelope Sheldon in a bear hug, practically lifting him out of his seat. Burke, who's having dinner with Sheldon, holds onto the table before it gets knocked over. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Spinner. Watch the ribs, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SPINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed you so much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed you too, champ. He drops Sheldon and pulls out his cowbell. SPINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been practicing and practicing and I got real good, Sheldon. Real good! He starts banging on it with a butter knife.      Sheldon cringes. SPINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna see me march? SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, why not. Spinner starts marching through the restaurant, clanging the cowbell. People who are trying to eat their dinner look annoyed. Sheldon sits back down at his table. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you were saying you had some good news? SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Some very good news. After giving it a lot of thought... I've decided to do the ice show. Burke gleefully slaps Sheldon on the shoulder. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally! I got me a bar mitzvah boy. Today you are a man! SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realize now it's a sin to waste your power. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like they say, rock bottom's a college education.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But here's the really good news: I'm doing it myself. No sponsors, no vendors, no crooks. Not one dirty hand will touch this. Not one person will make a dollar off these kids. Smoochy on Ice will be a study in purity. Burke's grin suddenly fades. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as food concessions go, I'll supply the refreshments. For free. Low sodium, whole wheat pretzels and apple slices. Healthy stuff. Now are you ready for the best part? BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm holding my breath. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All profits from ticket sales will be used to built a state-of-the- art methadone clinic in Coney Island. Burke looks pale. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not just talking a run-of-the- mill clinic... I'm going to build a methadone palace. A place where men and women can withdraw in luxury. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon, you can't do an ice show and cut out the vendors. And more importantly, you can't cut out the Parade of Hope. It's suicide. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always told me, when you've got muscles you make the rules. Well, I'm feeling pretty strong right now. Sheldon rises and tosses his napkin down.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this time I was letting the business use me. Well, I think it's time I start using the business. I've got my clout back and I'm not gonna waste it this time. Take care of it, Burke. Sheldon exits.    Burke sits there, looking very concerne On his way out the door, Tommy stops Sheldon.       Spinn COWBELL CLANGING continues. TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shel, you gotta help me out. He bangs that goddamn thing from morning till night. I got a headache that goes from my eyes to my ass. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever I can do, Tommy, just say it. You know I love Spinner. And I owe you. TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give the boy something else to do on the show. Anything. Just as long as it don't clang, chime or honk.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: frightened.    There's a gun to his temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chick, the Asian representative of Takashi, holds a revolver on Stokes. His cohorts, Sambo and Tobi, stand by. CHICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like complications, Frank. You got one week to get Takashi that slot or you're gonna be shakin' hands with Buddha. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you understand? My hands are tied. The rhino's been exonerated. The show's more popular than ever.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CHICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sambo and Tobi) Okay, boys, chop him up, bag him and dump him in the woods. Sambo and Tobi start to advance on Stokes. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right! I'll take care of it! I just need time! Chick leans into Stokes' face. CHICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One week, Jeeves. Got that? Or I get a blender and make an Orange Julius with your feet. They exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A down-and-out Randolph shuffles along in ratty bedroom slippers. He passes a MAN who sits behind a small table on the sidewalk. The table has a huge photograph of a rhinoceros taped in front of it. Literature and pamphlets depicting the black rhino are spread out on the table. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save the rhino! Before it's too late! Make a donation! Save the rhino! (to Randolph) Hey, mister, ya wanna help save the rhino? Randolph just looks at him for a moment. He looks at all the rhino-related imagery. He starts shaking and suddenly jumps over the table and attacks the Man. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the one who needs to be saved! Me. I'm broke! I lost my lawyer! My only friend kicked me out! I'm a fucking peanut shell in the shape of a man! Save the Rainbow! Save the Rainbow! Save the Rainbow! MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!   Someone call a cop! Randolph grabs the collection can and runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a chilly, grey afternoon. Stokes and Burke walk alon the lake framed by the New York skyline. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your client is suffocating me. To make matters worse, he's caused me to veer into a hazardous situation. A situation that otherwise could have a very happy ending. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me more about the Asians. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're ruthless. Unwavering. Unprincipled. And best of all, they know how the game is played. They respect our delicate ecosystem of mutual benefit. Stokes stops walking and grabs Burke's arm. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd bring you in on this, Burke. You'd be my partner on the Takashi deal. Split down the middle. We have an opportunity to get back on track here. Back to the way it was. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good old days. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pre-rhinoceros. The two men look at each other as thoughts pass silently between them. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is very sticky ground we're about to walk on. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're used to a little glue on your shoes. Burke smiles. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me poke around. Sift through the possibilities.

dialogues.speaker: EVENING
dialogues.text: A slender young man in a Peter Pan costume in being held by a big thug as another thug beats him up. A girl dressed as Tinkerbell (also being restrained) looks on in horror. Merv Green (Parade of Hope) steps INTO FRAME. MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what happens to guys who keep secrets, Johnny. JOHNNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you the rest next week! I promise! MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not me you're fucking over, it's sick kids. You got something against sick kids, Johnny? The thug punches him in the stomach again. JOHNNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!   I love sick kids! Merv nods to one of the thugs who releases Peter Pan.   H slumps to the ground. Merv kneels down and lifts his head from the pavement. MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you tell that fat producer of yours, if he ever gives me a low head count again, he'll lose the other thumb. One of Merv's thugs leans in, whispers something to Merv, who looks up to see. Burke standing in the mouth of the alley. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merv Green. How's tricks, kid? MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if it ain't smilin' Burke. Whose bones are you pickin' today? BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles) You got a minute, pally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke and Merv walk along 42nd Street. A poster advertises Peter Pan "Sponsored by Parade of Hope -- Giving Children the Gift of Promise!" Merv's thugs trail behind. MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one freezes me out of an ice show. No one. I don't care how many fucking clinics he's trying to save. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm chokin' on the same bone as you. MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're trying to aggravate me, you're doing a hell of a job. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not here to aggravate, just educate. I think Mopes might be talking to people he shouldn't be talking to. MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an ugly string of words. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got it in his head that he's gonna clean up the way we do business. (beat) Truthfully? I wouldn't be surprised if he's wearing a wire. Burke looks at his watch. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, I got a thing across town. He steps off the curb to hail a cab. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's keep talking, Merv. There's oughta be some kind of solution. Don't you think? Burke hops into a cab.   Merv watches the cab pull away.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: SNAP open. The table is set on the sidewalk. A man's legs ENTER the FRAME and shakily climb on top of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randolph stands on the table directly in front of the Kidnet Building. He raises the megaphone to his mouth. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention, New Yorkers! You are about to hear a shocking story of injustice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randolph stands on the table directly in front of the Kidnet Building. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I urge you to listen! It has a surprise ending you won't want to miss! A crowd starts to form on the sidewalk. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the story of a venomous rhino and his aggressive campaign to slander, vilify, defame, denigrate and villainize my good name! But one thing he can't do, is take my life from me. No, friends, only I have the power to do that! He reaches down and picks up a can of gasoline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what Smoochy has done to me! He's brought me to this! I can no longer live in a world where the innocent suffer and the wicked thrive! Randolph raises the can over his head and pauses dramatically. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is God                        !

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He drenches himself with gasoline. The crowd grows larger. He holds up a pack of matches. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to do this, people. Don't try to talk me out of it. The crowd starts to applaud.     Randolph looks baffled. MAN IN CROWD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it!   Light it! RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guest of honor will be here any moment! This is for his eyes! For his conscience. He'll have to live with this imagine for the rest of his miserable life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon sits in the back of a limo on his way to work, reading the paper. The headline blares: "SMOOCHY ANNOUNCES ICE SHOW AT GARDEN." The subhead reads:

dialogues.speaker: "ALL PROCEEDS TO BENEFIT BROOKLYN CLINIC."
dialogues.text: SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to driver) Take it from me, Lester. Use your power. Don't squander it -- build with it. LESTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound advice, Mr. Mopes. If I ever get any power I'll give that a whirl. (notices crowd up ahead) Hey, what's going on up there? Sheldon glances up from his paper. SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually) Looks like a street performer of some sort. He goes back to his paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randolph sees the Kidnet limo approaching.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it, folks! It's showtime! I'm sorry to do this, but he's left me no choice! Randolph tries to light another match, but it's wet from the gasoline. The crowd laughs and starts taunting him. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, you hillbilly assholes! You're borough trash! Go back to your huts across the river! Randolph keeps trying to light the match. Finally, after several attempts, it lights. He holds it up. The crowd burst into applause. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! Fuck all you people! I was the last of the Mohicans! You'll never see another Rainbow Randolph in this lifetime! You had me and you blew it! All of you! He turns and faces the approaching limousine. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This if for you, Smoochy! Remember this! As long as you live, remember this image! You did this to me! He brings the match closer to his gasoline-soaked body. The limo continues to approach. The crowd taunts him to do it. He tries to bring the match closer, but his hand is shaking. Suddenly, a LITTLE GIRL pushes through the crowd. Everyone quiets down as she looks up at Randolph. LITTLE GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha doin', Rainbow Randolph? Randolph freezes as he looks down at the Little Girl. A slight look of hope comes over his face. She smiles sweetly at him, walks over, and blows out the match. Randolph is overcome with emotion. Just then, Sheldon's LIMO WHOOSHES past him. The crowd cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoochy!!!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They all run away from Randolph and over to Sheldon's limo as it pulls in front of the Kidnet Building. Randolph stares at them blankly. He looks down. The Little Girl is gone. Sheldon gets out of the limo. The crowd cheers him as he waves to them before going inside. A look of utter frustration now comes over Randolph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randolph drops to his knees on the table, looks skyward, and screams. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it all mean                        ! The CAMERA RISES ABOVE him as he lets out an anguished howl that REVERBERATES through the skyscrapers.

dialogues.speaker: FACE OF SPINNER DUNN
dialogues.text: SPINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean I can't play the cowbell no more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon gently tries to break the news to Spinner who's on the verge of tears. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too talented for the cowbell, Spinner. Cowbells are for babies. SPINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little angry) I ain't no baby! SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. You're a fully grown man. With whiskers... and scars... the whole sha-bang. That's why you deserve a bigger role on the show. A more important role... Spinner's face starts to perk up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the middle of a Smoochy taping. Smoochy and the Gang are wrapping up a song entitled, "My Stepdad's Not Mean (He's Just Adjusting.)" The kids in the bleachers are singing the chorus. KIDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Stepdads are people too/ They have bad days, like we all do/ Be patient and help them through/ Stepdads are people too...' Smoochy continues the song. SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) ... 'So three cheers for the man that I proudly call Stan... He's not quite a dad or a brother... Yes, he gets cross, but still he's the boss... And besides he takes care of my mother!' The song ends. The kids in the bleachers applaud. Smoochy addresses them. SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, kids. First impressions, good or bad, are not always what they seem. Just like a new puppy, new dads need to adjust to their surroundings. So give 'em time! But always remember... if he becomes abusive to you or Mommy... what are the magic numbers? KIDS IN BLEACHERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting in unison) Nine-One-One! SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right-o-riffic! The Smoochyland Band plays a little fanfare. SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now, boys and girls, I have a special surprise. I'd like to introduce the newest member of the Magic Jungle... my cousin... Moochy the Rhino!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Smoochyland Band plays a happy little song as Spinner Dunn, in costume as Moochy, runs on stage. The Moochy costume is identical to Smoochy only it's a darker orange instead of bright orange. SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howdy, Moochy! Welcome to the Jungle! You wanna say howdy to the kids? Spinner freezes.       He stares at the camera. SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moochy? SPINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Moochy. SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. We've established that. SPINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning into Sheldon) Sheldon, this costume's makin' my nuts itch. Sheldon looks horrified. The Smoochyland Band quickly launches into some music. Smoochy, Moochy and a few other jungle animals begin to dance. Moochy's lumbering movements are in stark contrast to the choreographed steps of the others. As a bonus, he occasionally scratches his crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A happy Spinner (still in costume as Moochy) pokes his head into Sheldon's dressing room. Sheldon, still in costume as well, looks drained after the difficult taping. SPINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was fun! Was it bad when I done that thing, where I tripped and knocked over the Flamingo and then he knocked over the cameraman and then those lights fell down on that lady's head?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine, Spinner. We'll edit it out. But tomorrow in rehearsal we're gonna work on a new thing called 'the importance of hitting your mark.' SPINNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great!    I get to hit something! Spinner dances off. A beat later, Nora enters and shuts the door. There's an awkward beat of silence. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read about the ice show. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the papers seem to be really covering it. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's great. What you're doing for that clinic. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. She nods. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need some clarification...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Spinner just needs a little more rehearsal. I'll get him there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I mean about us. Sheldon looks uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever since you've been back I just feel like there's something that's not connecting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'm still readjusting a little. Like a guy who's come back from the war. Not that I'd equate my misfortune with the brave men and women who protect us overseas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought we were on our way to something... granted, my mistaken belief that you had ties to Neo-Nazis might have put a damper on our relationship, but I'm sorry for -- Sheldon suddenly jumps up and grabs her. He kisses her passionately. Nora immediately starts ripping off his costume as they make out. They fall to the floor in a lustful embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spinner, humming to himself, lumbers down the hallway on his way to the wardrobe room. Halfway down the hall, he hears a voice call out to him. VOICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- rhino. Spinner turns around. The door to the fire exit swings open. Two of Merv's thugs emerge and grab Spinner (who's still in full Moochy costume) and drag him into the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spinner is dragged into the garage and knocked to the pavement. Several more thugs emerge from the shadows, including Henry, Merv's main henchman. They start beating him with lead pipes. Henry pulls out a REVOLVER. He SHOOTS the rhino several times. A sedan trunk is popped open and Moochy is thrown inside. The CAR SCREECHES up to the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CRANE DOWN FROM a Chinese banner that stretches across two tenements. We LAND ON the seedy, deserted street below as the SEDAN BARRELS INTO FRAME and SQUEALS to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Two thugs emerge from the car. They pull Spinner/Moochy from the trunk and toss his body by some garbage cans, knocking a few over. They get back in the car and speed away. Moochy's lifeless foam body rolls into the gutter and lays motionless. Blood seeps through his foamy torso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Spinner/Moochy. We SLOWLY START TO RISE UP as we LOOK DOWN AT the rhino's body. The WIND WHISTLES through the empty street as we get HIGHER. The Chinese banner rustles THROUGH the FRAME. As we get HIGHER AND HIGHER, we hear the intermittent CLANG of a PRIZE FIGHT BELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the same frame, detectives and uniformed cops are now at the scene gathering evidence. Where Spinner once lay, there is now a bright yellow chalk outline in the shape of a rhinoceros.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FULL FRAME ON a TELEVISION screen.    A local news anchor is reading the top story. ANCHOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Former heavyweight contender and restaurateur Lawrence 'Spinner' Dunn was found shot to death in a rhinoceros outfit early this morning in Chinatown. Dunn, a frequent performer on 'Smoochy's Magic Jungle,' was pronounced dead at the scene. Police are searching for -- A hand ENTERS FRAME and violently slaps the TV OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An enraged Merv Green glares at his henchmen, Henry and MITCH. MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you hit the wrong rhino?!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HENRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knew Smoochy had a cousin Moochy? They look fucking identical. MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoochy is bright orange, Moochy is burnt rust! Read the papers! Do I gotta take you back to fucking kindergarten? MITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you said was 'hit the rhino.' You never specified the color. I'm not taking the blame for this one. Merv's anger builds. He turns to a picture of Smoochy which is tacked to a bulletin board along with other kid show personalities that the foundation extorts. Merv picks up a letter opener and violently thrusts it into the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not through with you yet, rhino! Your time will fucking come!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops rummage through Angelo's apartment. In the b.g., a detective, ELLIS, interviews Angelo. Another detective, McCALL, is looking through some papers he found. McCALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie, over here. Ellis walks over. McCall shows him some scribblings he's found in a notebook of Randolph's. The crude drawings depict Smoochy with his head cut off... with a knife in his heart... being pissed on by Randolph, etc. "Die, Rhino, Die" is scrawled hundreds of times, filling page after page. The two detectives look at each other and nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spinner sleeps forever in an open casket, clutching his cowbell. Dozens of Spinner's relatives are at the wake.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A bagpipe player plays "Amazing Grace." Sheldon stands at the casket, fighting back tears as he stares down at his old friend. Nora has her arm around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my fault. He'd still be alive if it wasn't for me. He would have been so proud to be in the ice show. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was nothing you could have done. Don't torture yourself. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Spinner.   I'm so sorry. Tommy and the boys walk over. Tommy puts his arm around Sheldon as he gazes somberly at Spinner. TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He really loved you, Shel. And this I guarantee -- that fucking Randolph has seen his last rainbow. We're gonna find him, cut off his balls, and shove 'em up his ass. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you better leave it to the police. DANNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't do the ball thing. It's against procedure. TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget -- that hit was meant for you, Shel. So from now on, everywhere you go, we go. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay, Tommy.   I'll be fine. TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, nothin'. And as Christ is my witness, no one's touchin' a hair on your fuckin' head. Spinner would have wanted it that way. Tommy's crew nods and agrees.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the boys) Alright, boys, let's get shit- faced. For Spin. They head for the bar.    Nora and Sheldon look down at Spinner in silence. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't Rickets the Hippo have a song about death? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The Last Nappy Time.' It gave me a lot of comfort when my mother died. (sings quietly) 'When doggies stop barking And fish cease to swim And Grandpa lays silent, from his head to his limbs Sadness will find you But soon you'll feel fine...' Sheldon joins in. SHELDON/NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'In life we all have Our Last Nappy Time.' Sheldon looks at her.    They embrace as BAGPIPE MUSIC SWELLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The news zipper in Times Square glides through the night air: "MANHUNT UNDERWAY FOR RAINBOW RANDOLPH... SUSPECTED

dialogues.speaker: SHOOTING, DRENCHED IN GASOLINE AND ACTING PECULIAR..."
dialogues.text: We CRANE DOWN FROM the zipper ONTO the sidewalk. Randolph is talking on a pay phone. We hear Angelo on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do it! I know you're still mad at me, but you gotta believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The papers say you were the mastermind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mastermind? I can barely figure out how to unzip my pants these days. Just taking a piss is a logistical nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you, Randy. But you can't come back to my place. They'll find you. You gotta go underground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are outside the long-abandoned Liberty Biscuit and Flour factory. The Liberty sign with its Statue of Liberty logo is eroded and partially missing.

dialogues.speaker: ACTION
dialogues.text: Inside the massive dormant factory, rats scurry around and pigeons occasionally fly from window sill to window sill. A makeshift living area has been set up in the middle of it all -- a chair, lamp, small table, hot plate, etc. Randolph lays on the dilapidated conveyor belt, huddled under a blanket. Angelo enters the factory through a rusty door, carrying provisions. ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's heatin' up out there. Every cop in New York is looking for you. And Tommy Cotter's boys are combin' the streets. You're gonna have to stay put for a while. Randolph sits up on the conveyor belt, blanket draped over his shoulders. He's a physical and emotional wreck. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was an altar boy once. Did you know that? I wanted to be a priest. Do you believe in angels, Angie?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angels? RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a little angel in pigtails. She was the only one who cared about me. She saved my life. Angelo hops up on the conveyor belt to console Randolph. Randolph rests his head on Angelo's shoulder. ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't want to kill yourself, Randy. You know that. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps it's time to heal. To accept the fact that Smoochy has won and gracefully march forward. True, I'm currently wanted for a murder I didn't commit. But I have faith. Faith that justice will prevail. ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're talkin', kid. This is a big step... I'm proud of you. He strokes Randolph's head. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you bring lunch? ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicken and stars? ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like you asked for. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have some, please? ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a smile. Randolph sniffs and manages a small pitiful smile. Angelo musses his hair. ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atta boy.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Angelo lifts one of the grocery bags onto the conveyor belt. ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, I got you some crossword puzzles and stuff to read. Angelo hops off the conveyor belt and turns on the hot plate. He starts to open a can of soup. Randolph reaches into the bag and pulls out a copy of the New York Post. The lead article's headline reads, "WAKE FOR SPINNER." A large photograph shows mourners leaving the restaurant after the wake. Clearly visible are Sheldon and Nora. They have their arms around each other. Randolph's eyes widen. He starts to hyperventilate. Angelo looks up. ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? Randy? Finally, Randolph expels a blood-curdling scream that ECHOES through the factory. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker!!!!!!! Angelo drops the soup.      Birds in the factory flutter the rafters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon and the Rhinettes work on some choreography for that night's show. Nora watches from the sidelines. As Sheldon skates on the ice rink, Merv enters with Roy and Danny. Sheldon skates over to them. Nora walks over, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big news, Shel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't Smiley who killed Spinner. It was Parade of Hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merv Green?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? The cops have tons of evidence on Randolph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did our own investigation. Cousin Ian from down at the morgue... you met him at the wake...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Tommy is at the bar listening intently to a man, IAN, who is pointing to certain details on a photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See the neck? Snapped like a twig. Animals... Parade of Hope's calling card. When they do a guy, they like to sign the tab. TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that guy's name over there? Green?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Merv Green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was one time they shoulda left the tab blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew Merv Green was a scumbag from the day he grabbed my ass at a 'Feed the Children' benefit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, God help those guys now. They're gonna get a first-class ride through the criminal justice system, and I'm buying the tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all taken care of, Shel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: A bloodied Merv Green is tied to a chair in the middle of the warehouse as he begs Tommy for his life. Merv's two henchmen lay dead nearby. Roy, Jimmy and Sammy -- Tommy's guys -- stand behind her. MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a mistake! An honest mistake! All I'm trying to do is help children. TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like kids, huh? MERV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!   Of course! TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you must know a few fairy tales. Danny, tell him the one about the worthless prick who gets his head chopped off. Danny, holding a hatchet, advances toward Merv. Tommy casually walks away. We STAY WITH Tommy. Merv is NO LONGER IN FRAME. MERV (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... no... no! He SCREAMS. We hear the sound of the HATCHET HITTING its target. Merv's pleading stops. TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you know why charities go under sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we really need to hear this? I don't want to hear this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clean cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then we took his head and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you! Specifics about his head are superfluous at this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora is alone in Stokes' office, rearranging cards on the giant cork board that displays the network schedule. She is startled to hear a deep voice behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? She turns around. Chick, Tobi, and Sambo are standing there. Chick walks over to the cork board. He scans a row of cards that all read "Smoochy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (attitude)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you with something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, honey, you can help us with something... He rips a Smoochy index card from the board, walks over to her and waves it in her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell that boss of yours he better take care of the rhino problem. In my culture we honor deals or invite consequences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about and your cologne's making me nauseous. Other than that, you're great company. Chick looks at his boys and chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spicy little thing, isn't she?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He suddenly pulls out a switchblade and holds it to Nora's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takashi gets that time slot. You hear me, girly? Tell that boss of yours we'll kill everyone at this fucking network if we have to. Starting with the pretty ones. He removes the knife from her throat and hurls it toward the bulletin board. It lands -- sticking right in the middle of a Smoochy card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auf Wiedersehen, honey. They exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora is pacing.    Sheldon sits by the fire. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Stokes. He's behind the whole thing! He cut some kind of deal for the Smoochy slot! SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants you out so he can put Takashi in! SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Takashi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Sheldon! Don't you ever pick up a copy of International Performer? He's the hottest kid show host from Asia. Sheldon's head is swimming. Suddenly the front door to to the penthouse bursts open. Randolph, dressed like he's about to do his old show, stumbles in waving a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! How very cozy. Like two logs in a little bonfire. All we need is a few sticks and some wienies. He almost trips as he stumbles over to Sheldon.      He waves the gun in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had her before you! Pachyderm! I was in love with her! In love! And you snatched her away! Like a common thief! You're the bad guy! Not me! He's the bad guy, Nora. He's incapable of understanding the love we once had! Tender, yet passionate. Old-fashioned, yet experimental. (cackles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him about a few of our experiments, Nora! Tell him! Sheldon looks stunned.    Nora hangs her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nora)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this true? Please tell me it's just the confused ramblings of a diseased mind. She looks at him, but doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy mother of Toledo. When exactly were you planning to let me know about this?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to Sheldon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, there was a time -- and I'm not proud of this -- but there was a time when I was a bit of a... kiddie-host groupie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just another action figure for her collection!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not fair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him about Jingle Jackson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dated Jingle Jackson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bells turned her on. Hey, tell him about Jumbo Johnny! There's a tale for ya! A whale of a tale! She looks down, somewhat ashamed.      A look of utter sh comes over Sheldon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh good Lord in Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, what I did before I met you is none of your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!   Both of you! This is my show! He waves the gun threateningly as he backs up to an armchair and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you fully understand the power of a condemned man? Do you? I'm already wanted for one murder, why should I give a flaming horse's twat if I commit two more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... uh... read once that the best way to diffuse a tense situation is with a little humor. To that end, would you like to hear a funny joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolling his eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please. Go blow yourself, Martha. (waves gun again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fix me a beverage, woman. Make me one of those drinks that used to make us all warm and fuzzy before bouncy-bouncy time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fix it yourself, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, I have Mr. Boomy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, you'd love this joke. It revolves around Santa Claus and the Easter Bunny getting into a fender bender. Nora rolls her eyes and goes to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sheldon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, when I lived here I used to have a big painting above the fireplace. A naked chick holding a pumpkin. It was very tasteful. No bush...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Randolph. We know it wasn't you who killed Spinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll go to the police, first thing tomorrow... straighten everything out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!  Goody-goody gumdrops! (to Nora)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vodka straight up is fine, sugar babe! He grabs the bottle out of her hand. He rises from the chair. He takes a CD, "PARTY TIME WITH RAINBOW RANDOLPH," from his pocket and puts it into an audio system on the fireplace wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you put on a little weight, honey? That's okay, you're still a hot little brood mare. I bet you miss the sweet sting of my riding crop. Giddy up, pony! The THEME SONG from his show starts to PLAY. He flicks a switch and a spotlight goes on. He sings and dances.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to tune of 'Ol' MacDonald) 'Rainbow Randolph is the man. Yes he, yes he, is. He's the Prez of Rainbowland. Yes he, yes he, is. With some fun, fun here, and a laugh, laugh there. Here a dance, there a song, Everything is fun, fun. Rainbow Randolph is the King, the King of Rainbowland!' Randolph takes another drink from the vodka bottle. Sheldon suddenly lunges at Randolph and tries to grab the gun. Randolph shrieks. The two men wrestle on the floor, but Randolph is not much of a fighter. He screams as Sheldon rolls him toward the fireplace. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this what you want? A Hansel and Gretel ending?! You want to be the big bad wolf? RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! It's too hot!    The heat! It's driving me mad! Randolph rolls Sheldon to the bottom. Nora reaches for a fireplace poker and whacks Randolph with it. Randolph cries out and drops the gun. Sheldon grabs it and points it at Randolph who lies on the floor, blubbering like a child. He's bleeding. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, kill me! Finish me off. My life's over anyway. Everything I touch turns to shit. Put me out of my misery. Sheldon slowly takes the gun away from Randolph's head. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not nothing. You're bitter, misguided and I'm guessing a raging alcoholic, but you're still Rainbow Randolph. Despite everything that's happened, you once made children happy. Randolph sits up and looks at Sheldon through watery eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you be my friend? SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nora)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about the brood mare stuff. Randolph throws his arms around Sheldon and cries into his shoulder. Sheldon pats his back. He glances down at Randolph's gun and sees that it's a toy. Nora pours vodka onto a small pillow she's taken from one of the chairs. She kneels next to Randolph and blots the gash on his head with the vodka soaked pillow. Randolph lets out a blood curdling scream.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: being loaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon loads his gun as Randolph is curled up on the couch like a little puppy. Nora hands him a cup of tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pitiful child)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. She walks over to Sheldon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Sheldon continues to load the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just making the playing field even. I'm tired of running this race with one leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're letting them drag you down to their level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from couch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right, Sheldon. Don't make the same mistakes I did. Keep your dignity intact. He accidentally spills some hot tea on himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son-of-a-bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate everyone's concern, but I can take care of myself. Nora and Randolph look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouthing to Nora)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried. Sheldon stuffs some extra bullets in his pocket. SHELDON (to Randolph)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, buddy, we have to get down to the Garden. You're welcome to stay here as long as you like. Just don't leave until I get things squared away. Randolph gets up and walks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful, Sheldon. Remember what I told you -- you've only scratched the surface of this scummy business. You have yet to strike oil. Randolph looks at him for a moment before turning to Nora.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky to have a guy like Smoochy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just rest, Randolph. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the real thing. Smoochy's the real thing. And I've been a fraud. A wicked man doing wicked acts. Sheldon slaps the cylinder into place and tucks the gun in his waistband. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we all have our bad days. He exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hula dancer performs on a tiny stage in the nightclub. A small Hawaiian string band plays behind her. Burke and a nervous-looking Stokes sit in a booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are getting out of hand. We have to cover our tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, everything's gonna work out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax? They found Merv Green's head on the Grand Concourse! Excuse my concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we can cover all the tracks we want, but in the end we still got the same problem. We gotta finish what we started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God help us... Stokes shakily takes a sip of his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll all be over tonight. Buggy's gonna take care of everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buggy? Buggy Ding-Dong? The guy who hosted 'Buggy's Bumpy Railroad'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, until he discovered the joys of Turkish black mule heroin. For the right price he'll do anything. It's amazing the guy's still alive. Stokes buries his head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Burke... this whole thing... A shadow falls across their table.    Burke looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak of the devil. Have a seat, Bug. Buggy Ding-Dong's hand ENTERS the FRAME and snubs out his Camel. Stokes looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (attempting to sound cheerful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buggy. You're looking good.

dialogues.speaker: BUGGY
dialogues.text: A man who looks like he would first kill you then eat you for dinner, slides into the booth next to Stokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time we put this thing to rest, Frank. And the way I see it... the rhino's up past his bedtime. Burke hands a folded envelope to Buggy who puts it into his jacket pocket. He lights another Camel.

dialogues.speaker: EVENING
dialogues.text: "SMOOCH ON ICE -- SOLD OUT!" flashes on the electronic marquee.

dialogues.speaker: ACTION
dialogues.text: Men, women and children flood in through the turnstiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ushers, costumed as Rhinettes, help people to their seats. People mull about the concession stands which are adorned with signs that read: "Complimentary Apple Slices!" "Have a Salt-Free Pretzel!" "Enjoy a Soy Dog on Smoochy!" "Fresh Squeezed O.J. -- Have a Glass!" "Sugar Free Brownies -- They're Not as Bad as they Sound!" "Free! Everything is Free!" "Keep Your Wallet in Your Pocket!" "Friendship is More Important than Money!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angelo's place looks like a cyclone hit it. Angelo works free from the ropes that have bound his wrists. He has been hit over the head and is groggy as he reaches for the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A freshly showered Randolph is wearing Sheldon's robe and has a pink towel wrapped around his head as he lounges on the living room sofa. He's eating grapes and reading National Geographic. The PHONE RINGS. He picks it up. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sing-songy) Hellooo! We GO TO a SPLIT-SCREEN with Angelo. ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, is that you?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Angelo, my little Twinkie, shouldn't you be getting ready for the big show? ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Buggy's been here. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buggy Double D's?   The Dong Man? ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he lifted my backstage pass and he's braggin' that he's doing some kind of job for Burke Bennett. Randolph thinks.    He suddenly looks very worried. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon's in trouble.   I gotta get down to the Garden. ANGELO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is crawling with cops. They'll jump on you like a trampoline. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. He rips the towel from his head. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to warn the rhino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buggy, in his ill-fitting Rhinette costume, emerges from the sub-basement carrying a thin suitcase. As far as anyone's concerned, he's just another usher. He heads for the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every seat in the arena is occupied. The lights are lowered. A slow rolling TYMPANY is heard. After a moment, the Rhinettes skate out to enthusiastic applause.

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE
dialogues.text: Sheldon, looking very intense, stands alone in the wings. He takes a couple of deep breaths. We TILT DOWN and see the bulge of the revolver under his Smoochy costume.

dialogues.speaker: ICE RINK
dialogues.text: The Rhinettes have formed a line across the middle of the rink. ANNOUNCER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now... it gives us great pleasure to introduce America's favorite rhino... ladies and gentlemen... boys and girls... (dramatic pause) Heeeeere's Smoochy! Smoochy skates out to thunderous applause. The entire arena is on its feet. The Rhinettes part as Smoochy skates through them and stops in the middle of the rink. The applause and cheering don't stop for several moments. One of the Rhinettes hands Smoochy a microphone. SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On behalf of myself, the Rhinettes, and the soon to be restored Coney Island Methadone Center, I thank you all for coming.

dialogues.speaker: NETWORK BOX
dialogues.text: Burke and Stokes roll their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON SHELDON
dialogues.text: SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my original intention that tonight's performance would be a benign mix of Smoochy songs and ice dancing. But as an artist, I believe I must convey to you, my fans, what I'm feeling at any given moment in my life. To do otherwise would be dishonest. Art is communication. It's something we learn and hopefully grow from. With that in mind... I hope you enjoy the show.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: More applause as Smoochy skates over to the Rhinettes. They form a circle around him and slap hands in solidarity. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for Spinner. The lights go down. A full orchestra begins to play the overture to WAGNER's Tristen et Isolde. The lights come up as a soprano -- a heavyset woman in a modified rhino costume -- skates out through the fog and begins singing the opera. Smoochy -- now wearing a peasant's frock -- skates an interpretive dance in the b.g. with a few Rhinettes who are also dressed as peasants. A beautiful fairy princess floats down (on filament wire) from the rafters and takes Smoochy's hand. She skates away with him as he waves good-bye to the Rhinettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOKING DOWN AT the opera. The CAMERA PANS OVER TO the catwalk high above the rink.

dialogues.speaker: CATWALK
dialogues.text: Buggy Ding-Dong, still in his Rhinette costume, settles into his assassin's roost. He begins to assemble the rifle and check the scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randolph emerges from a cab and runs through the crowd outside the Garden. A few people recognize him. MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Rainbow Randolph!   Someone stop him! Randolph finds a side exit and slips into the arena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "Opera on Ice" continues. The soprano continues singing as Smoochy reenacts the incidents of his recent life. The fairy princess brings Smoochy to a room with a gleaming white desk. Smoochy takes a seat behind the desk. The fairy princess places a crown on his head, bids him good-bye, and floats away. Smoochy sits proudly in his new world.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Rhinettes dressed as devils glide in and skate in a circle around the desk. They throw money at Smoochy. He jumps up and skates away, but the Rhinette devils pursue him with daggers. The music from the orchestra intensifies as the drama plays out.

dialogues.speaker: NETWORK BOX
dialogues.text: Nora continues to watch the opera, totally entranced. Stokes and Burke look a little on edge. Burke glances at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: CATWALK
dialogues.text: Buggy finishes loading the rifle. He shines the barrel with his sleeve and looks through the scope as Smoochy and company continue to perform below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atmospheric fog created by the smoke machine is so thick that Buggy has difficulty FINDING Sheldon THROUGH the cross-hairs. Occasionally, Smoochy skates through a hole in the clouds only to disappear again. BUGGY CURSES in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: ARENA
dialogues.text: Randolph pushes his way past Garden security and runs toward the rink. Several cops working the event spot him. A few spectators scream in horror.

dialogues.speaker: ICE RINK
dialogues.text: The soprano's mournful aria reaches its crescendo as Smoochy is now pursued by Rhinettes dressed as Nazis. They hold signs with words like "SCANDAL" and "SHAME." Smoochy skates to a section of the rink resembling Chinatown where he lands over a fallen "Moochy." He cradles Moochy's head in his arms as the Nazis glide past him and disappear into the fog.

dialogues.speaker: NETWORK BOX
dialogues.text: Nora wipes a tear from her eye as she watches the tragedy play out. Burke and Stokes glance skyward. Nora notices this.

dialogues.speaker: RINK'S EDGE
dialogues.text: Randolph reaches the rink as cops push their way toward him. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon!!! But Sheldon can't hear over the orchestra.   The soprano hits a high note.

dialogues.speaker: CATWALK
dialogues.text: Buggy aims the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoochy glides THROUGH the cross-hairs followed by a Rhinette.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON BUGGY'S FINGER
dialogues.text: as he quickly squeezes off a SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: RINK
dialogues.text: The MUFFLED sound of GUNSHOT is absorbed by the intense music. A wounded Rhinette falls to the ice, but no one notices. Smoochy, oblivious, continues to skate toward the "gates of heaven" with the angel Moochy.
