Giant white gates slowly swing open at the rink's far end as floating angels open their arms to welcome Moochy.

dialogues.speaker: OUTER RINK
dialogues.text: Randolph runs around the rink's perimeter, trying to get Sheldon's attention. Cops and security push their way towards Randolph. He suddenly notices the felled Rhinette on the ice and looks skyward. He can make out a rifle barrel protruding from the catwalk.

dialogues.speaker: NETWORK BOX
dialogues.text: Stokes and Burke notice a commotion in the audience. They now see Randolph running through the crowd on his way to the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to Burke) What's he doing here?! He's going to screw everything up! Nora notices the distressed look on their faces and follows their gaze to the rafters. She now sees the rifle barrel.

dialogues.speaker: NORA
dialogues.text: jumps to her feet.      FAST PUSH IN TO Nora's mouth. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Sheldon!!! She starts to climb out of the box but Burke stops her. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora... NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in on this, aren't you! You sold him out! You fucking snake! Stokes tries to put his arm around her. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nora, please. It's not what you think. I'm grooming you. You're going to run the division one day... She pushes him. He goes down hard. She starts to climb out of the box. Burke tries to grab her, but she spins around and punches him. She runs for the rink. Stokes stands in the box looking dumbstruck as pande- monium plays out around him. People are running in all directions, cops are everywhere. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened; to Burke) What now? What do we do now?! BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Survival of the fittest! Burke runs off through the panicked crowd. Stokes looks around and heads off in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE RINK
dialogues.text: Tommy and her boys notice the commotion in the audience. They see cops pursuing someone. They realize it's Randolph. Tommy, Jimmy and Sammy take off after him.

dialogues.speaker: CATWALK
dialogues.text: Buggy, in position again, looks through the rifle scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the soprano reaches for an impossibly high note, the fog dissipates slightly and Smoochy's foam rubber head COMES perfectly INTO VIEW.

dialogues.speaker: BUGGY
dialogues.text: smiles.

dialogues.speaker: RINK'S EDGE
dialogues.text: Nora screams. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon!!! Get down!!!

dialogues.speaker: BUGGY'S FINGER
dialogues.text: He's about to squeeze the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: CATWALK
dialogues.text: Randolph reaches the catwalk as the orchestra plays a dramatic series of smashing notes. He tackles Buggy just as he squeezes off the SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: RINK
dialogues.text: The top of Smoochy's foam rubber head is blown off. In SLOW MOTION, Smoochy's tattered horn sails through the air and lands softly on the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the arena screams and heads for the exits. It's pandemonium. Thanks to Randolph, Buggy's shot was too high and just missed Sheldon's skull.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A confused Sheldon bends over to pick up a chunk of the Smoochy head. Nora, who's entered at the opposite end of the rink, tries to reach him, but it's impossible. Panicked audience members run across the rink, heading for the exits. It's chaos. People slip, Rhinettes get trampled.

dialogues.speaker: CATWALK
dialogues.text: Randolph tries to get the rifle away from Buggy. They struggle on a narrow beam high above the rink. The cops have reached the outer edge of the catwalk now. Tommy and the boys get there a second later. They all stand back -- the catwalk is too unstable. RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me that gun, you fucking wacked-out freak! Buggy manages to shove Randolph off him. He raises the RIFLE and SHOOTS at the cops. Randolph grabs him. Both he and Buggy lose their footing and slip from the catwalk. Randolph is able to grab onto the edge and hold on. Buggy clutches Randolph's leg which threatens to bring them both down. They dangle 80 feet above the rink. Randolph desperately tries to hold onto the catwalk as Buggy clings to Randolph's ankle.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOLPH'S FINGERS
dialogues.text: His knuckles turn white as his fingers start to slip from the beam.

dialogues.speaker: BUGGY
dialogues.text: Still clutching Randolph's ankle, he starts to lose his grip. He desperately grabs Randolph's foot, but Randolph's shoe slips off and Buggy begins his long plunge to the next life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buggy screams the whole way down, still holding onto Randolph's shoe.

dialogues.speaker: RINK
dialogues.text: Buggy crashes into the middle of the rink, cob-webbing the ice around him.

dialogues.speaker: CATWALK
dialogues.text: Tommy and his boys runs off to find Sheldon. The COPS help Randolph off the catwalk. He's a nervous wreck. COP #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? RANDOLPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm kind of fucked up in general, so it's hard to gauge. They pat the dazed Randolph on the back.   He passes out.

dialogues.speaker: RINK
dialogues.text: People continue to run through the rink. Felled Rhinettes litter the ice like broken dolls. Smoke fills the air. Sheldon is helping a random woman to her feet as Nora finally reaches him. She embraces him. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke's with Stokes.   He's been in it all along. Sheldon looks toward the network box. Beyond it, through the smoke, he sees Burke shoving his way through people who jam the exit trying to escape. Sheldon reaches into his costume and pulls out his gun. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Sheldon, don't! Sheldon runs off leaving Nora.

dialogues.speaker: EXIT
dialogues.text: Burke is almost through the cluster of people. He glances over his shoulder and sees Sheldon heading toward him. He shoves even harder now and finally gets through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burke makes a run for it down 33rd Street. A moment later, Sheldon emerges from the building. He sees Burke in the distance and takes off after him. He's still in his skates and wearing the partially-blown-off Smoochy head.

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER DOWN STREET
dialogues.text: Burke looks behind and sees the nightmarish image of a disfigured Smoochy chasing after him. He quickly rounds the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few moments later Sheldon rounds the corner. He looks down the street and sees no sign of Burke. He notices an alley by an abandoned building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon walks slowly into the alley, gun drawn. Suddenly, Burke jumps out from behind some boxes. He whacks Sheldon's head with a garbage can lid. The gun goes flying. Burke goes for it, but Sheldon is quickly on his feet and pounces on him. The two men fight it out. Burke manages to get on top of Sheldon and starts to strangle him. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking point a gun at me? A gun I gave you as a gift?! Where's your fucking etiquette? Just as Sheldon begins to lose consciousness, we hear a GUNSHOT. Burke looks up. Nora stands there, pointing Sheldon's gun directly at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him go. Burke just looks at her. NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. Before I pump one in that Grecian Formula scalp of yours. Burke smirks as he releases Sheldon. Sheldon jumps up and takes the gun from Nora. He shakily points it at Burke. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know something, kid? You've turned out to be an incredible pain in the ass. Burke slowly stands up, brushing off his suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were behind the Spinner hit, weren't you?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a tragic mistake. (shakes head sadly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If only one could turn back time... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what the hell, it's just one less mick in the world. He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son-of-a-bitch. Sheldon cocks the gun. BURKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my. What are you gonna do? Kill me? That wouldn't be very Smoochy-like behavior. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. There's just one thing... Sheldon tears off the remains of his tattered costume and steps out of it. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not Smoochy. Sheldon is shaking as he extends the gun to Burke's head. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finally realized we're living in a different jungle. Burke suddenly looks fearful, as does Nora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Sheldon. Sheldon closes his eyes as he tries to summon up the courage to pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon! Suddenly, there's a voice from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it, Shel. Sheldon turns around.       It's Tommy and her boys.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sternly) Stay out of it, Tommy.   This is my business. Tommy walks closer to Sheldon. TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more killin', Shel. Enough's enough. Don't destroy who you are for this piece of shit. You mean something to the kids. Don't take Smoochy away from the kids. Tommy extends her hand for the gun. Sheldon looks down at the gun. He can't believe he's even holding it. He hands it to Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how I got pushed this far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're only human, Shel. The important thing is... you never went over the cliff. You're a good boy. For some of us... it's too late. Tommy pats Sheldon's shoulder affectionately. TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take it from here, kid, you run along with your girl. Get on with your life. Sheldon looks over at Burke, who's petrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy, you're not going to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Sometimes even a rat deserves a little mercy. Sheldon and Nora take a final look at Burke before walking out of the alley. Burke is wide-eyed with fear as Tommy's boys advance on him. Just as they round the corner there is the sound of TWO GUNSHOTS. Sheldon looks at Nora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bus backfire. She pats him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stokes finally makes it out of the arena. He runs toward his waiting limo and hops in the back seat. He barks to his driver through the glass partition. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here! The car doesn't move.   Stokes pounds on the partition. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move this thing! No response. Stokes frantically pushes the button that lowers the partition. It slides down. STOKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you deaf?! I said -- The driver turns around. Stokes recoils in horror. It's Takashi. He smiles as the back doors open and the Japanese thugs -- Chick, Sambo and Tobi -- pile in with Stokes. They slam the doors shut. CHICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could tell you it'll be quick and painless, Frank, but you know how these things go... Stokes lets out a small whimper. Chick nods to Takashi who steps on the gas as he sings "Anything Goes" in Japanese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car heads into the night, passing Sheldon and Nora, who have exited the alley. This will be Frank Stokes' final limo ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheldon and Nora pause on the street.    Sheldon looks around him. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, a little grime here and there doesn't change the fact... it's still a beautiful city. He looks at Nora.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NORA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go home, Smoochy.    Show's over. Sheldon gazes back at her. SHELDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it's not. It's just beginning. They kiss passionately as MUSIC SWELLS and the CAMERA CRANES HIGH ABOVE the rink.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: The Garden is sold out.    The lights go down.    Through P.A. we hear... ANNOUNCER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now... it gives us great pleasure to introduce America's favorite rhino... ladies and gentlemen... boys and girls... There's a dramatic pause; TYMPANY ROLL. ANNOUNCER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heeeeeere's Smoochy! Smoochy skates out to thunderous applause. ANNOUNCER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his partner and comrade... the one, the only... Rainbow Randolph! Randolph skates out, somewhat shakily, to huge applause. Sheldon puts his arm around him. The audience is now on their feet. Randolph especially basks in the adulation. ANNOUNCER (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All proceeds from tonight's performance, will benefit the Rainbow Randolph Center for Alcoholism and Delusional Behavior.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sheldon pats Randolph on the back. MUSIC BEGINS as Rhinettes and Krinkle Kids skate out. The show starts and the audience goes wild. Nora smiles from the stands as Smoochy and the others glide across the ice. (SMOOCHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE END
